ReviewContent: This is my favorite place around lake merritt.   On Saturday nights, they have a dj in the back.  Sometimes you get lucky with some excellent old- school house music djs.

My go to bar in my neighborhood. Amazing staff, they're all like my family. Lighting and ambience is super clutch. If I need a drink not on the menu, they serve it right up. Really love they have people serving snacks and food on certain days. Love them, and always will:)
Great cozy neighborhood bar with a relaxed style and vibe. Solid cocktails and beer on draft.
Great space, cool wall art, good draft beer selection, great cocktails and chill eclectic vibe.
Great location that really adds character to the neighborhood. Whether to want a quick drink or a chance to listen to good music, this spot fits the bill

Fun bar with a lot of Halloween decor in October! We came on a Friday around 8:30pm and there were a few open tables with some standing room. We weren't sure if there was a set cocktail menu (it seems like there isn't), so we ended up getting some Long Island Iced Teas. The drinks were strong and smooth, and I got served pretty quickly at the bar. However, it wasn't ideal that the bartender didn't even ask if we wanted to keep a tab open. We had to pay and tip right away, so we actually left after one drink. Overall, this seems like a fun, neighborhood bar, but because there aren't any signature drinks, I'm not sure I'd go out of my way to come back.

I came in the afternoon, around 6-7. Looking for a place to do some work. I was a bit wary of the description mentioning a bar and glad I took the dive. They offer a very pleasant outdoor seating with a high bar and chairs that offer both street viewing and more confided space in the corner. This inside was packed with people so it had that scene of the bar to offer as well. Free WiFi as stated and they serve a mean old fashion.

This bar is so cute but they don't have non-binary bathrooms, what year is it?   Supposedly either you are a man or a woman which is a very complicated and awkward situation for most of my friends. Fuck that. But the bartender Kat came outside personally to give us some love and clarification. They will change it up soon in my dreams. It was amazing that Kat acknowledged my gay ass. In a world where trans rights and non-binary people are being hated on left and right I appreciate it. 100% @teamkat

Listen....there are very few establishments that I will throw  my whole weight behind, but room 389 is the one. She is that girl. I've been living in Oakland for 10 years now and drinking in this bar for just as long. The bartenders are incredible, the ambiance is immaculate, and the drinks never ever ever miss! I can't rave about this bar more. It's a neighborhood bar with a whole vibe. Kindest humans ever...oh did I mention they do to-go drinks?!? Literal perfection for grabbing a Bev and chilling at the lake

The question is WHY has it taken me so long to write a simple review for my favorite Oakland neighborhood bar?I absolutely love Bar 389. For YEARS I have come here to study/write during the day (everyone needs their work space with a full bar) and kick it during the night. When I say years, I mean over 10 years. This is THE neighborhood bar, like Cheers "where everybody knows your name"Service is always great. No matter time of day or amount of crowd, I feel that the bar crew do their best to be attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable. Courtney, Lalo, and Tyler stand out , but all have been super nice and make cute quality drinks. Feel free to ask them to make you something special, even a snazzy water. Although there is not an extensive food menu, the empanadas, chips, and salsa are delicious (the salsa is fire). They do not mind if you bring in outside food. May I suggest that good good Round Table across the street. Very cute atmosphere, a little hipster vibe. DJ some nights, good playlist the other nights. Plenty of board/card games to keep yourselves occupied in case conversations get slow. TVs for spots watching. Clean. Clean! bar and bathrooms, plenty of seating in and outdoors. Plenty of on-street parking. Overall just a chill vibe, chill clientele. Remember; cashless bar and, my favorite, drinks to gooooooo!

The decor and space itself deserves the one star. As far as the rest of the stars missing, that would be attributed to service. We walked in around 8pm roughly. Went straight to the back by the bathrooms and saw all tables pretty much empty. No indication of reserved tables. Our group of four settle in and go up to the bar and grab drinks. As the night goes on, the bar starts to fill up. We grab some cards and start to play. About 45 mins after we are playing cards the bartender (woman with braids) comes up to our table and begins to talk to one of our party members. I am sitting within vicinity so I can hear the conversation. Bartender says she's made a mistake and forgot to reserve the table we've been at for 2 hours at this point. That the party is waiting for the table so she has to clear it for them. My fiancée mentioned to the bartender is she could find us another table and if we could wait at that table until she does. Mind you three out of the four part my members still had half beers left. The bartender rudely switches up her attitude and snaps back I have to move you it's non-negotiable. As she says this she quickly starts snagging everything off the table except the half full beers. We grab our things and proceed to cash out our tab. She rings us up and took a beer off the tab. The issue was that a mistake was made. I understand we are all human. I felt as though it was mishandled very unprofessionally. Although, I initially apologetic at first, when question about alternatives we were met with an aggressive non-negotiable like we were being unruly. Will not be returning.

One star for the type of beers on draft, lack of rest of the other stars because of the service. Our party of 4 came in on a Saturday night and ordered two rounds of drinks. Out of nowhere in the middle of our second round the bartender came to rush us off of our table because she had forgotten to reserve it earlier. No one had come up to us before to let us know they needed the table. Instead they decided it was the best course of action to immediately  begin picking up drinks and cards from our table because she needed us to move right now and it was a "non-negotiable." In her favor she offered to comp our next round but when we told her we were already on our last round (we weren't staying after how we had just need treated) she said "oh well, we'll keep it in mind to get you next time". That was our first time there and most definitely going to be out last.
One star, bad service. Own your mistakes. If you forget to reserve a table for a large group, don't take it out on other customers. Treat people with respect. Definitely won't be coming back.

Lately I've been feeling really depressed until I had the decadent chai latte at this establishment. It changed my marriage, my relationship with my father, and more importantly my relationship with Indian beverages.
My favorite bar in the Bay. Great music, friendly energy from the staff and customers alike, and of course, delicious cocktails!

We were strolling around the city and came by this bar, so we popped in to get a margarita which the wife was craving. The heavy metal bartender was super cool and she was busy running back and forth preparing all the patrons drink orders. The special drink was the Mango Slushy margarita which was delicious.

It's one of my favorite bars in Oakland. I was so relieved they managed to stay open and survive the pandemy. I stopped by recently for a drink with my bf, I ordered their Spiked Chai Latte which blew my mind. The spice, the flavor, the viscosity, the balance of the rum *chefs kiss*. The ambiance has also improved a lot more. It used to be a lot more divey, but I really like what they've done to the place. Ambiance is super chill, this would be the perfect place for date #2, if work has you stressed & you want a nice, affordable, tasty drink, if you're in the neighborhood, if you want a quick shot, the world is your oyster, and this place delivers!

I have always enjoyed this local bar but the change has been the dogs! The dogs come with their owners and it's overwhelming. Yesterday the dog was on the bar paws and all while the bartender is mixing drinks. Unsanitary!!! Did I mention I love dogs but not near our drinks!

I'm not a big warriors fan.. actually let's be honest, I'm not a big sports person. However, yesterday I popped on over to meet friends at this cute bar in Oakland to watch the semi finals.The drinks were delicious but a tad overpriced. Even the chips were a little over priced ($6 for a small basket) but the habanero sauce they are served with was oooofff SO GOOD The crowd was so friendly too! We all cheered the warriors despite their loss and I really got into it despite not carrying about basketball. I took a star off mostly because the bouncer kept asking my group of friends to move even though there was no where to stand without clouding the view of the TVs for other patrons. We were standing in the corner near where I took this picture and 100% not interrupting the flow of traffic nor the entrance... so I don't know what the deal was there.Look forward to coming back!
Really good cocktails and a good selection of local beer. Cosy interior. Getting a cocktail to go and walking around the lake is a great way to spend a weekend afternoon

Good place to have one drink with a cute date! I had Modelo with the house tequila as a side. She had the hibiscus marg! The total for both drink orders came out to be about $20 ... Cool ambiance and I really enjoyed the music that was playing.
Nice place with a great vibe. Tried this during dry January. They were able to accommodate my requests for low and/or no ABV drinks.

So I have had this spot bookmarked for years.  And I am so glad I finally made it!  I love it here.  The music was groovy, the drinks were great , service was excellent, crowd was cool.  I had gin and grapefruit with real pink grapefruit.  Such a fan of real grapefruit!  Next time I want to try the warm apple cider.  This is gonna be one of my go to spots now.  The lighting inside makes it so cozy.  Would love to come here with a group of friends and chill on the couch seating in the back.  Plenty of parking when I was there.  Bathroom was clean.  Enjoy.
Best cocktails! My friend said, "that's the smoothest margarita I've ever had". Great place to chill, more lounge than bar = great!
All-around good. The cocktails are great, and I really like their special blend coffee, which is infused with cinnamon and is delicious!

I have been here a few times this winter, in the afternoon on weekdays or early evenings on the weekends, I've never really been there for the late evening crowd which I understand leans more into being a cocktail bar experience. In the world of cafés plus bar combinations it can be hard to find anywhere that strikes that balance, let alone one that executes it as well as Room 389.*Drinks*My experience there has been consistently positive because of the bartenders who can make or break a bar in my opinion - one bartender in particular who was running things alone seemed knowledgeable and professional on a couple visits. They have made great alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks as well as offered rewarding suggestions when asked. One of the best lattes I've ever had, which I was a pleasantly surprised by since I wasn't really expecting coffee there at all there on my first visit just walking by.*Atmosphere*It seemed like quite a few people go there to work and I can see how it could be a productive environment in that it's generally pretty peaceful with reasonable distractions - it's the kind of place people might bring their dog inside but it's a pretty mindful atmosphere and doesn't get too loud. It's a really versatile space because not only could you come alone, meet with friends, go on a date, read or do some work but they also have TVs for you to watch sports for example I recently watched the 2022 World Cup there.
Great little bar in the east bay. Fun atmosphere with a great selection of local beer, including sours, which is sometimes hard to find. Friendly staff.

We live in the neighborhood and thought we would stop by tonight for some beverages. Unfortunately the female bartender could not have been less welcoming... she was borderline rude from the minute i approached the bar. She had several other customers, so it took her a minute to get to me. She didn't even say as much as "hello... I'll be right with you." She ignored me (and the other guests) waiting to get drinks completely until she came over and said "What can i get you?". No hello or any niceties, even though i went out of my way to say "Hello, how are you?"... She was looking and acting totally bothered that i was ordering drinks. If you don't like people or being a bartender then find another job. We drank one drink then decided to go to Heart and Dagger where the bartenders are kind and who want to be there. If we ever stop by again and she is there we won't stay. We go out several times a week and spend lots of $$ but won't be spending any of it here anytime soon.

Stopped in on a late Sunday evening and really enjoyed my experience. The vibes were immaculate and the drinks were great. It was a nice crowd for a Sunday and we were able to sit at the bar. Our bartender was super friendly and attentive. Enjoyed my experience and I'll definitely be back when I visit Oakland again.

My friends and I came here on a Sunday around lunch time. We were looking forward to getting some drinks in to kick off our day in town, and were really excited but we walked into an empty bar with one bartender who didn't even bat an eye at us. The menus were void of any food or snacks that would be worth buying and when we finally got our drinks, we weren't very happy with them. My sangria, which I expected to be rather sweet, was the strongest sangria I've ever had. I couldn't finish it and had my friends help. One of my friends got a grapefruit drink that sounded delicious but when we tried it, we just tasted salt (and not just from the rim).Service is definitely lacking here and the bartender didn't seem to put much care into our drinks. The only thing she didn't mess up on is the rosé because it just comes from the bottle. If you plan on coming here, don't do it on a Sunday afternoon. I'm assuming it's better at night.

Been coming here for years... great memories. Good drinks. Usually really kind and friendly staff... that seems to be trending downwards hard. The lady today was practically throwing drinks at me. I even apologized thinking maybe she thought because I was busy working on my phone... that just made her more rude. Eye rolls... didn't even listen to what I was saying. Just walked off. Maybe she having a bad day but it seems people bringing a-lot of those to work these days. Leave it at home and enjoy the break?! ‍

Great spot in Oakland CA! Came here for the first time with my cousin and we had a good experience. Nice and clean atmosphere. Friendly staff and good customer service. The greyhound and paloma were delicious. We plan to come here again.

It's the perfect bar. It's my local pub. It's an extension of home at this point. Some mornings I grab coffee there and stay long enough into the afternoon to get their sangria (arguably the best in Oakland). On weekend nights it's packed with friendly people, dogs, more dogs, and tasty food popups (think tacos, noodles, etc). Jamie and the crew are good people. The drinks are inexpensive and plentiful. The vibe is relaxed, friendly, and there's always good music. I can't ask for more.
Even though they say on Yelp that they serve  " coffee and tea" , if you come after 9pm they will tell you that you can only serve alcoholic drinks. That should be stated.
Such a hidden gem. Great service and really cool vibe. Great spot to come for coffee in the morning or on a week night for some super yummy drinks.
A great space to catch up with friends or get a little work done.Great service. Art. Smiles. Keeping a sense of humor is helpful too
Good strong well made coffee. The Asian barista is so friendly and establishment has a chill overall feel

The staff are okay. Somehow EVERYtime (4x) I've come here my friends card is used for some transactions (e.g.  an Uber to the city) and she has to dispute the transactions.  Needless to say, use cash only at this place!!! One of my friends forgot her card there, went back the next day and they added an extra $30 fee for storage and retrieval?  Count your change, I was shortchanged $9 once and had to call the bartender over!  Ugh!!! The drinks are cheap and the atmosphere is great with art all over the walls!  Went on trivia night, was fun!!  Good place for 1 drink in cash!
Great bar on a vibrant street right next to Lake Merritt! It's cozy and has a moody atmosphere. I like the outdoor seating area in front and the couches in back.
Super friendly staff (I think the bartender who served us was named Tyler?). My co-worker and I got the greyhound, gimlet, spicy mango w/ mezcal, and paloma. All were amazing!

I stopped in to get some studying done on a Sunday morning and had a bomb ass Irish coffee... or 2. I wouldn't recommend the empanadas they weren't that great but the staff was super friendly and the music was real chill. They played football all morning too so if that's your jam but you want a laid back environment this is the spot.

Its a smallish cozy-cute style bar. It has a very "lived in"/ relaxed  vibe. SUPER casual. The drinks were good. I had a couple of Palomas and they were nice and stiff lol the only thing I didn't really care for is that you can't open a tab. But otherwise, I enjoyed it and will be back.

I began coming here regularly during shelter in place. A and I would order drinks and take it to the park where we'd catch up. Hot drinks during the winter, cold drinks in warmer weather.People were always awesome here and i just liked the variety during the day.Then recently, I came here and they're fully open. The parklet is great, there's room indoors, and they check for vaccination at the door.

A friend and I were looking forward to having a drink there. But the doorman was incredibly rude and abrasive for no reason. After checking my vaccine proof, I kindly asked him what elSe was needed, as he just stared at me. Then he yelled,"YOUR ID IF YOU EXPECT TO GET IN!!  It was incredibly abusive and unprofessional. Because of this, we decided to get drinks at Enssaro instead.

What a cool spot near Lake Merritt!  Great music vibes, dark and social interior, lots of couch seating , dog friendly and super bartenders!  We stopped here for an after dinner at Grand Lake Kitchen.  We enjoyed the Irish Coffees.  Such a nice night in Oaktown!
Good beer (they had a decent hazy IPA) they also serve coffee here and you pay at the kiosk before they pour you beer which is a little bit weird, bartender could've been friendlier but she was ok

I stopped by yesterday evening to grab a few drinks and would summarize Room 389 as a great place to hang out with friends. The place wasn't too crowded on a Friday night, there was plenty of outdoor seating, the bartenders were very attentive, and there's a very solid selection of beers, cocktails, and even alcoholic slushies! For the cocktails, you can opt for a double as well to save yourself a few bucks. If you like a spicy bloody mary, definitely try out the one from Room 389.

So far, I've been here several times. A TOTAL oasis in Covid era Oakland. My friends and I affectionately call this place "the bungalow" and it is terrific. Their walk up bar is easy, the take away cocktails have saved me! Prices are steep for a double ($18) but I can always justify a single. They are stiff enough as it is. The sangria is fab and there are slushees on the menu for spring! They are now open for limited indoor seating where you can gather in small groups. Pups are welcome inside if they are well behaved. I love that this place opens early. And stays open late. A true gem.

Pretty goodThis is such a cute bar I stumbled upon on the way home. I definitely will be coming back to grab a drink with the girls. ** What I got: - matcha latte with oat milk: fairly regular matcha latte. Doesn't really have the real matcha kick. 3.5/5 stars $6.50I would come back just to grab drinks with the girls and maybe skip on the coffee and lattes, lol.
389 coming in clutch with the boozy cocktails all quarantine! Irish coffee is a nice way to start the day sometimes :)

Sadly I was not able to experience Room 389 pre-covid but I dig the vibe of the spot: Coffee in the morning, optionally spiked, and a beer or a cocktail starting at 3p.I've only been a handful of times and haven't been disappointed with anything I've had. If you can find parking in the area and it's a nice day to be out, they're in an perfect spot to grab something to drink and hang out by the lake. The first 2 things that come to mind for recommendations are their Vietnamese coffee and their slushies. You might pay a little more than you'd expect for the slushies but they'll definitely hit ya...at least it did for me.
Groovy little spot with a cute patio, cute staff, quality beverages made with love  the cafe has a good variety of reallly delicious baked goods!

I'm so stoked you can get delicious to go frozen drinks here! I wish you could hang on the patio but it's small so I get why you can't. There's a lot of stuff I'm sure we all wish about this year lol. Tip the bartenders well cause they're taking a risk so you can have a semblance of normal during a pandemic by getting a delicious to go drink.
Very yummmy cocktails! I got the spicy ginger thai drink! I love how they're serving drinks in mason jars and giving people a $2 refund. I love this!

Had a terrible Bloody Mary at portal so I needed to redeem my palate with a better BM. Hence, I headed to room 389 for a double Bloody Mary. It was as delicious as I remembered. I love how I get to take my Ball xtra large glass jar home as well.. double win. Bartender and cashier were friendly and nice.

Let me start by saying I know a pandemic is going on and it's tough on everyone. We've been to this place a couple times since the pandemic started because they have to-go drinks. The first time I had cash and felt bad about not tipping because I had bigger bills, so I said "here's $20 just give me $15 back" we only got 2 drinks so I didn't have to tip but did anyway, she barely said thank you (she doesn't even make the drinks). We went back today and there was a sign saying if you bring back the glasses they give you they'll take $2 off of your drink. Since we had been there a couple times we felt like we missed an opportunity because the glasses are just at home. I asked her "is that sign new?" with an attitude she says it's been there "forever" then also claims it was written at the bottom of the menu. I'm writing a review about this so clearly I would have remembered either of those things. Overall she's just not polite. As I said earlier she doesn't even make the drinks, there's no reason to be rude. Convenience is the only reason we keep returning.

I have never been so disappointed in a place before. I brought my daughter with me becuase I heard how good this place was. Loved the inside and the vibe but was not treated right. We ordered 3 ice teas and we ended up being over charged. I sent my daughter over to ask about the price and the lady working there said " are you really mad about a f**king dollar?" Im going back becuase i just heard about this I cannot believe she thought it was ok to talk to a kid like that and have attitude the whole time we were there. She made us feel unwelcome and rushed. She was extremely rude and denied giving the 1.50 back. Their tea wasn't even that good so were going back.
Your tape obviously missed the theft. Wasn't faded. I don't drink alcohol and was very clear on what happened. Good luck with your business.

I came here for the first time a couple weeks ago, and managed to have a delicious afternoon coffee. It was a perfectly made cappuccino - thank you! The space feels like a shared co-working space, many people scattered around working on their laptops and taking calls! It's also simultaneously a bar and coffee shop, with great tunes. I have not been  here at night, but will certainly return during the day and for happy hour. Really liked the space and the vibe. Outdoor seating and bike racks out front.
Loved this place! Super cool vibes and nice cocktails. Went midday on a Saturday and had a good time.

If you're interested in a chill spot to sip a delicious Hot Tottie, this is the place. The board game section in the back makes an even better date spot. During the day, the location can be considered a low-key cafe for studying or causal meet-ups. It's a great spot for all things social. It does not have a dance floor but you can catch a Warriors game.
Love Room 389 and would give 5/5 stars, except they don't have gender neutral bathrooms. Hoping management will read this review and make changes!

nice little unique (dive bar) place for small group to hang out... not for big group. have a wonderful night with my couple of friends sitting at the bar then moved to the back at the sofa area. place is not pretty but very clean, didn't have to roll up my pant when using the restroom. lol
The drinks are professionally made. The bartenders are efficient, the decor is ugly but at least it's clean..

Awesome neighborhood bar! Cool friendly staff...It's has a patio!!! Trivia night, dj's & delicious food pop ups!! What else can you ask for when it's only a few blocks from the lake where everything is happening!! Very Oaklandish!

Nice neighborhood bar that has a chill vibe to it. I have a friend that lives nearby so that's how I discovered this bar. Plenty of seating inside and by the time I left around 10PM, it wasn't super busy for a Friday. Their cocktails from the menu are actually tasty as I tried a friend's drink but they made a good moscow mule too. They had 2 TVs playing basketball games and a DJ playing music in the background (it kept on going between reggae, instrumental, and some old school hip-hop tracks). You can actually have a conservation here too as it's not too crowded. They have some tables in the back where you can play card or board games, if you wanted to.

Loves this bar! Good, healthy pours, great vibe with the music and ambient lighting. A couple patrons had their dogs there, which is always amusing to pet cute doggies :) would definitely recommend as a great first date option!

Needed a place to hangout at for a bit before a friends flight got in on a random Monday night & just my luck that this place was open. Not only are they open late night they had a live band!! The ambiance was really nice, very sultry with the red lights across the ceiling, bathrooms are clean and well stocked. Drinks were amazing! If you want a cool date night spot or somewhere to just chill with a friend, check this place out. At the end near the bathrooms there are huge communal couches & tables were you get a front to the live music! Very jazzy scene. Love it here!

This is a great (five star) bar EXCEPT for the fact that they illegally scanned my driver's license without my consent. I've come here for years but last night, instead of just looking at it, they SCANNED it. Total shock at the invasion of privacy and illegality of recording my driver's license information. The doorman simply pointed to a sign high up on the wall that said they were doing this. When I asked him questions about WHERE OUR INFORMATION WAS GOING, or what app it was, given this secure information, he admitted to not knowing. Enraged by this violation, I decided to write this post. After years of going to 389 Room, I'm hoping the owners stop this highly upsetting activity. Handing one's driver's license to a doorman is totally normal at a bar, but having your highly sensitive personal information recorded for NO REASON is bullshit. For a cool neighborhood bar this privacy breach (especially in the Bay Area) is unbelievable, not to mention opening up their patrons to identify theft. Again, I hope they stop this ridiculous practice that they just started. A bar should be a relaxing place, a fun place, not a creepy place. I'll update if/when 389 Room aborts this practice that violates the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA). 389 Room is OBLIGATED to inform patrons of data collection, must tell us where exactly our private information is being stored, who it's being shared with, and they must delete our information on request.(Update: 389 can apparently soon be fined for not upholding the CCPA.)Other than this practice, 389 Room is wonderful.

Dropped by for Happy Hour to relax. This place has a great vibe.Something weird happened that I want to alert you about. I ordered a Brown Derby. The bartender asked me if I wanted the house bourbon, Evan Williams or another.  I chose Buffalo Trace.I noticed while he made me drink with EW. So did another patron.  I mentioned it to him. He said Eagle eyes.  Then he bought my drink.Not sure if this was a management directive, a mistake or trying to trick me. Just want to say watch your drink being made.
Good spot for doing work during the day and then hanging out for a drink after. Great location too.

Cute bar to say the least - it is most unique because they are open day and night and cater to an eclectic, diverse crowd.If you're hanging out at the lake or have just come from a walk or workout- it's great and super convenient to get refreshments here.I'm pretty much a regular here since there are so many venues/activities around the lake (and for some reason men love to meet here for drinks). I live in Millsmont and work in Emeryville, so I pass through this part of town between home and work - it makes such a good midway meeting place for happy hour/ after work drinking spot.
Yummy drinks and a great vibe.  What more could you want from a neighborhood bar?

Many years ago I was a regular and I take issues with the owner Ben and his lack of management. He has been known to be an asshole to people; he drinks heavy on the job and is just a shady person! For example he allowed his staff to steal a phone, lied about it, and acted like he didn't know what was going on. Some of the staff at Room 389 are decent, but they are cliquey and if you want a cocktail right away forget about it-the bartenders are usually real slow to serve you. Generally there's always lots of unnecessary drama going on at this bar, from the owner, to management and on down to their aggressive doormen... so enter into this bar's insanity at your own risk. Believe me, there are far better establishments in the Oakland area to spend your money at. It's never a good idea to support an establishment like Room 389 or their sister bar Mad Oak, especially because the owner doesn't really care about the customer. He's THE local douchebag!

I'm really bummed that my local bar took up a turf war with the taco truck that parked in front of their place.  You're allowed to take food inside the bar, but not from that one specific taco truck that has been parking there for years.  Just recently this all changed because I have been eating those tacos inside that bar for quite a while.  I overheard one of the bartenders saying it was because they don't want them parked directly in front of the bar...which makes no sense because people loved getting food right outside and coming back in for a drink or to watch a game.  It was good for both businesses.  Then after a while they get different people to make tacos on the patio, and it came across as a petty and anti-Oakland maneuver.  Drinks are a bit pricey for the lack of customer service.  Do yourself a favor and walk a little further to Heart and Dagger.  Good people, good drinks, affordable (esp. the happy hour!), you can bring ALL food inside, always an interesting movie being shown, and you can just pass by 389 and it's crew hanging out on the low road.

Rasta Cue and I-dj stace-from April 2018, putting Parliament's "Motor Booty Affair" title track into the mix. Room 389 is one of the few places where you can still listen to real deejays spinning vinyl, or wax-and you can see that it's a disc, thus the term disc jockey, or DJ for short. If you're not using vinyl, you're not a DJ. You are a technical jockey, or TJ. Anyway, Room 389 is a chill yet sacred spot for great drinks, laid back attitudes and hip hop junkies alike.

This is a really cute and unique coffee house/bar.You know that outfit that goes from office to night on the town, this is that outfit made into a bar.During the morning hours until 3pm it provides coffee and there are people working at the tables on their computers. After 3pm it begins its transition into happy hour and an evening bar scene.How cool is that?I went here for coffee. Unique about this place is that outside of the various standard coffees it also provides Vietnamese coffee. Some of the strongest out there! Got too scared to try it this time for fear that my heart would beat out of my chest. Next time for sure. Cute, unassuming, and uniqueFive stara

Super cute bar. Great ambiance and interesting (but tasty) drinks on the menu. My mans & I visited on a Saturday evening: there was a DJ & decent crowd. Definitely making it one of our go to bars in the neighborhood.

Was out for walk with my dog today. Weather started warming up so stopped so my dog could get a sip of water from the bowls on the patio. Next thing i knew, my dog started pulling me inside the bar. Seen another doggy inside so i decided the place must be dog-friendly. I got a cold beer while my dog took a break on the cool floor--think he needed the break from our walk. Nice dog-friendly atmosphere where i can chill with my dog and not be bothered by some old dude tryna by me an unwanted drink--just sayin...
Went here one evening on a fluke and would definitely come back. The vibe here is amazing and atmosphere is very laid back with a rustic charm. Bartenders are friendly and drinks are not overpriced.

Met a friend here after work. She and I stood by an empty spot at the bar with menus. Bartender was busy on the other end of the bar so we waited patiently for about ten minutes. A tall older man walks over to the bar and stands about 3 feet away also looking like he wants to order a drink. The bartender comes over, passes by us and says "I'll be with you ladies in a moment" and b lines for the guy for his order. At first I'm thinking, huh? Does she know this guy?The guy tells her to let us go first, so she comes back and says, oh he's letting you go first. What would you like?I'm glad the guy told her to serve us first, but why does she assume he was there first? Do we need his permission for her to defer to us? Why does she assume a taller white man was the one "in charge" or the one first in line? Is it because he's a tall white man? Is it because she didn't see us because we're short women? I don't know how that's possible if we were already standing there for 10 minutes and she had to pass us to get to him. You're told that bartenders have a third eye and to not be pushy to get their attention. From this experience I'm going to conclude that's bullshit. Assert yourself everywhere, esp if you're small, a woman, or a minority. It's this sort of behavior that makes getting credit for your work, getting acknowledged when you're standing in line for service, so much harder for certain people just by virtue of how they look and the assumptions people make about them, based on societal bias. If this is unintentional subconscious bias, it's even worse.Side note: we had to proactively ask for popcorn that everyone else had after we paid for drinks- and to top it off the popcorn was stale. Yeah, not coming back. See my post about a similar experience at Drakes.

Visit: 6/4/19Stopped by with two friends to grab a drink after having dinner across the street. The SERVICE was mediocre. The bartender was not friendly at all, rude and appeared annoyed. The DRINKS were good but I was a little disappointed that the drinks I ordered; "the Diablo," was pre-made. I'm sorry... but, if you're going to be a bartender, I feel like a cocktail such as mezcal, pineapple, jalapeño, etc should be made fresh! Would I come back? I would because my friends and I really liked the AMBIENCE of the bar but I will make sure to stick to ordering a beer on tap, and stay away from the premade drinks.    Parking:  Gotta find street parking. Careful to reload the parking meter.

Great bar with amazing drinks!  Came for happy hour and to watch the warriors game. Not the best place to watch a game since there were only 2 TVs at the bar and very limited seating. Would definitely recommend coming for the happy hour. Drinks are reasonably priced and delicious; my favorite was the Peruvian disco

***THIS REVIEW IS FOR CUSTOMER SERVICE FROM ONE SPECIFIC PERSON***My best friend and I came in because Yelp suggested it was a good place to get work done. We came in at about 2pm, and sat at a table in the back because the only power outlet in the whole place was back there. I ordered an Irish Coffee, she ordered a grilled cheese sandwich. A couple hours later, we were talking about ordering something more, when a male employee came up to us and said, very rudely, "if you're going to sit there you need to spend some money here." My friend politely replied that we had, in fact, spent money there. He responded rudely again with, "if you're going to take up this much space, you need to spend more." OHHHH, I suppose I must have missed the sign that designated exactly how many inches one is permitted to take up per dollar spent, as well as the exchange rate for dollars per minute spent at this place. What an asshole. In fact, we were only using half of the table for our work. I'll never come back to this place. Too bad, too, because I live very close by and spend a whole lot of time on the weekends at cafes studying and spending money. This was so close to being my new spot. I'll take my money elsewhere. To the very sweet female employee who politely came by to pick up my empty glass and even apologized for "interrupting" me (you didn't!), you're a rock star and I'm sorry you have to work with such a douche bag.

I really think one thing is important: When a customer comes in and is waiting, and one person is working the coffee orders and maybe 2 or 3 minor food orders....in other words not overwhelmed....it is just not acceptable that they avoid all eye contact and essentially ignore you. In terms of human interaction and customer service, it's just weird to me.This girl never smiled to anyone the entire 95 minutes or so I was there.  I am assuming this place tortures her in the back room.Her bloody mary was terrific; I'll give her that. The chicken quesadilla, whoever made it, was a culinary atrocity. I almost yacked as I tried to eat it, leaving 70% of it for the varmints digging through the dumpster. Order it at your own risk. Wow.If there is one thing I can't really tolerate at an eatery of any kind, it's someone working the counter who really doesn't want to be there, and advertises it in every way. Too many other places to go that show the other side of the planet.
Great atmosphere for getting some work done and enjoying a great cup of joe. I had the cold brew and will Definitely be back soon!

I love the vibe at 389! This is one of my favorite happy hour places. If you are in the area, I would definitely recommend it.Things I like:The laid back atmosphereGood drinks at reasonable pricesGreat interiorFriendly bar staff

Great bar AND cafe! At night Room 389 has a lively outdoor area (in the front) with lots of room inside the bar. In the very back there is a dimly lit couch area with options of board games to choose from. Also a great day bar for a casual drink, and dogs are welcome inside the bar!The cafe is equally great, their regular coffee blend usually has some sort of cinnamon mixture that is delicious. It's also a reasonably priced coffee ($2!!) which is a rare find in Oakland. There are some food options to choose from, although I have never tried the food here.Prices are very reasonable, definitely recommend!

We went here for a quick coffee trip after a Korean lunch date. And I will never forget how good my mocha latte. The place is cute and the staff service is great. From then on when we are in the area I make sure to stop by and buy a cup of coffee. Note: I don't drink alcohol but surely am addicted to coffee!

Love, love this bar. Great drinks, friendly bar tenders, and a wonderful ambiance. A night place to have a get together with friends and/or watch any game. Parking can be tricky sometimes, but I've always enjoyed my time when at this bar. The owners are super nice and makes you feel like you're part of the family. Dont let me forget about the dirty chai tea that's amazing. And during the winter time they serve amazing spiked apple cider and buttered rum. Both are delicious. Definitely one of my favorite bars.
Amazing drinks, great beer selection and a crowd of cool, respectful folks and their dogs. Comfortable. Cool. Delicious and boozy. What more do you need? Also AMAZING when a game is on!

Went here because I saw they had a good happy hour and they weren't wrong. $5 dollar wells is right up my alley. The atmosphere is also super cool inside and out. Returned later that night and it was packed!! But it was still a great time, and the drinks were so good! They make greyhounds with fresh grapefruit that they squeeze right in front of you! Will definitely be going back soon.

My favorite cafe. In/outdoor seating with plants everywhere  Everyone that works here is super sweet & easy to speak with. Manifest function = get turnt while being productive. Latent function = puppy therapy

Nice neighborhood bar by the lake.. popular with locals. can get quite crowded most evenings but nice drinks, though last visit they couldn't make the one drink I go there for called the Green Lush... said they didn't have  the ingredients ready... booo!

I love that this place is coffee shop by day - bar by night! Room 389 is the place I treat myself for a delicious chai tea. Always spicy and flavorful! Sitting on the front patio or taking it to go for a walk around the lake - it's the perfect companion! The beer selection is always creative and unique including some local classics. Their cocktail list also fits the experience of interesting and delicious combinations. I rate this place as a perfect spot for solos, friends and dates! It's a great all around location!

Great bar excellent drinks and friendly bartenders EXCEPT ONE! She was very condescending and sarcastic. She Walked right up to the line of being insulting with NON-genuine customer service and a clear dislike of assisting guests. I give her much credit for her creativity in how to give out disdain & sarcasm and remain .3 inches on the correct side of the line (or so she thinks). She even gave me crap about ordering a signature cocktail from the menu instead of a call drink (aka: any alcohol and 1 mixer).  Yes, she did spin the shaker and show some flair but the sarcasm made it an utterly disgusting show to receive since she clearly did not want to make the expensive cocktail. I am a Bartending Professional and I know the struggle is real so I still tipped her but what she said and how she said it made me regret it immediately. We have gone there on quite a few occasions but no more (changed plans yesterday to avoid this place). Sorry her amazing coworkers have to deal with her bringing low class and negativity to a really nice place. I was so happy to be out for date night with the wife and friends! I had a smile on my face that turned to ashes in my mouth and flavored all the beverages we ordered.

Slow service. Asked if she was going to turn the Sunday ticket on and was asked if I was going to buy something first. Of course I was going to buy something, I was still deciding on what I wanted. Decided to take my business elsewhere, where I felt more welcomed.

Great, attentive service! Lovely atmosphere and chill music. Mid 20s-late 30s vibe on a Fri night. Clean bathrooms are much appreciated! The lounge area is interesting and adds dynamic to the joint; it also has a DJ station. Wouldn't mind droppin by next time we are to watch the fire-spin show down the block at the lake.

Room 389 is cozy, local watering hole near Lake Merritt. Last Friday, at a friend's recommendation, we stopped by for a drink and were pleasantly surprised by the mix of patrons. It was an eclectic mix of demographics which was a welcomed relief from the hipster-type establishments invading Oakland. It's promising that unpretentious establishments like 389 still exist in Oakland where you can just come as you are and share a drink with friends.
Dope ass neighborhood bar. Drinks are reasonably priced and the vibe is just right too.

Super chill bar. They play all types of music, drinks arent overpriced, and the bartenders are cool. It's in a low-key spot so don't expect anything too fancy but the vibe is great so if you're looking to chill and have a few drinks by the lake this is definitely your spot.

Weird service in the daytime.  The place was mostly empty and I was the *only person* putting in an order, but to get a hot chocolate (at the cafe register) and a beer on tap (had to go to the bar cash register 10 feet to the left) took a full 15 minutes. Because I could not get the three people behind the bar to "see" me.  They were obsessively squeezing citrus and cleaning off the steamer nozzle to not take my order.  Not so much fun.

Nice bar with great vibe and atmosphere. Perfect date spot. Strong drinks, good music and board games.  We needed up playing Cards of Humanity with a few people we were seated by. At the bar they have sangria which is a must try! Tends to get more populated around 10p.

Solid bar, with a large back area which is great for large groups. Solid beer selection as well! I had a gingery-cider that I liked in particular. I haven't been during the day, but they seem to have a nice outdoor patio area out front too.

The staff was very dismissive for sure, give attentions to their regular crowd. I would strongly encourage all visitors stay away from this place. Order a beer and told the staff would pay in cash. After over 40 minutes of no services, decided to leave. When requested to pay cash again, the staff decided not to listen.... terrible at best....
Dope spot in the O with good drinks, seating and lite bites. Always a cool spot.
Ohhhh me so loveeee dis place!! Love day ambience, day peepole, and da musac. I be back fo more
Great place if you only want drinks and the music. Good atmosphere. There are also board games if interested
Close to home..walking distance from Lee Street. . Drinks are great.   Small intimate atmosphere.. nice location..

One of my SO favorite bars, as it is just a short downhill uber from his place (also because we are a fan of jong ga house and kinga sushi, that is super close). We actually find this place while waiting for out table at jong ga house and LOVE their happy hour. I always like a place that has fresh grapefruit juice for their greyhounds. The space is spacious, but when there is a warriors game, be warned that there will be standing space.

I really love this place. But I had a crappy bartender recently. I asked for ouzo, she has no clue what it was, and gave me attitude in the process. I later asked another bartender, he said they didn't have it but proposed some similar liquors. I told her it was from Greece. She said 'I've never been to Greece' Neither have I! What kind of response is that? Do you need to go to Mexico to know what Mezcal is, Argentina or Italy to know what Fernet  is, or France to know what Champagne is? Come on...it's cool if you don't know what it is but hold the attitude. The drink the other bartender proposed was good.
Just what I needed on a hot day!  Cold beers and chill vibe.  Would definitely recommend!

The drink was great. The outside patio was nice. However, I ordered my drink and when the bartender finished it he gave it to me and just stood there. I was waiting for him to say how much it was - which is always what bartenders do but he just stood there. I looked at the board for the price and handed him enough money to cover the drink plus a two dollar tip. He asked if I wanted any change, which is normal. But he had this sort of guilty look on his face. I realized it was happy hour and asked how much the drink actually was, and of course it was a lot less than I had given him. The interaction felt gross. I had to wonder, is that why he wasn't telling me the cost of the drink, because he was trying to work a huge tip out of me? I would go back to this place because it's convenient to my work - but wow, what a lousy bartender.
Great touch adding flowers to the rest room Great music too, vinyls and also games cool
Awesome vibe!  I feel like I'm in Havana! I could totally  hang out here all day! Coffee and cocktails!  I love the Kraken spiked chai latte I tried, and the food tuck out front was seriously yummy!

Visiting from out of town with a friend who lives in the neighborhood.  Started out as a pleasant evening with a very nice bartender.  Things went south when I was waiting for the bartender who apparently I was assigned to as I was standing directly in front of another bartender who was talking to her friends about how pleasant the day was and what was going on in the park. I didn't mind, I figured I'd wait, but considering I'm a customer and she took my empty beer can and I'm still standing there waiting for service while she continues to talk to her friends seems a bit ridiculous.  When she finally sees me still waiting she takes my order and as I get my beer and start to walk away she asks me if I have a tab and as I get ready to respond, my assigned bartender tells her I do and I walk away.  After a while I go back to get another drink and the backup bartender tells me she closed my account because I walked away from her without telling her my name when she asked me what it was.  I reminded her that as I was going to respond the other bartender told her I had a tab going, she did not want to hear it, and the other bartender sadly took her side.  This was truly a disappointing experience. I travel to Oakland on business quite often, and I have never been treated with such disrespect.  I'm not some 20 year old individual, I am a 52 year old well traveled individual who knows how a person who  is spending money in a business should be treated. Granted, the place was full and I'm sure the regulars will keep it open, but I'm sure the owners would like new business and positive recommend it to his coworkers who work in the area.

389 is cool.  It's hard to describe the vibe of a place, but what I like most about 389 is the diversity of people in every way.  I saw some pick up flirting at the bar -- and a couple playing the game "Battleship" in the corner.  The music is great, sometimes intense, but at the same time the place feels low key.  It's genuine, authentic, not trying hard to be anything it's not. The night I was there, there was a Mexican food truck parked outside, where you could buy great food and bring it inside.  Creative and brilliant.

If you come here and keep an open tab, watch out! They have tried to over charge me, probably assuming I wouldn't notice after having a few. And don't ever leave a card here after closing. I did that once and found two fraudulent charges on the account the next day. One for a local Oakland business and one for Uber. Was a fun neighborhood bar of mine, but who wants to visit a place that gives you fake plastic smiles while trying to rob you?

I came in from out of town to try the place out. Unfortunately the bar staff wasted no time in being short and unwelcoming. They let me know the cafe menu was invalid since it was after 3pm (that's fair but why then was there a removable sign hanging outside saying 'cafe open'). I lightheartedly said "ok, so no quiche then?" (referring to the menu online) and they proceeded to say "no, there is no quiche, EVER." I understand and respect dietary choices being vegetarian myself however it is quite discourteous to get defensive and arrogant. As a result I quickly left, disappointed in coming short of experiencing what the establishment had to offer.

Brought a work group here and loved what we found. Fresh squeezed greyhounds on the happy hour menu?!  Yes, please! Teachers Happy Hour goes from 3-5 M-F and is the best deal in town. Good, local, friendly crowd, nice bar keeps. It's a keeper!

I came here to meet with someone on Saturday morning. Apparently, it's a coffee shop in the day and a bar at night. It was nice as it wasn't super crowded in the morning and they have free wifi if you bring your laptop. I got the Mexican hot chocolate which is pretty good, but you definitely pay the Bay Area price for it.Overall, it's a chill and relatively quiet spot to meet up with someone or to get some work done. I'll have to check it out when it's night.

Super awesome atmosphere. I like how there is the typical bar seating or in the back there is couch seating. Makes for a little more intimate setting. The music was nice and it was an eclectic crowd. Loved it!

I absolutely loved this place. I've been to Bay Grape across the street a million times and could never quite figure out what Room 389 was. We decided to go for an early dinner at the Indian place next door and had a half hour to kill before they opened so we stepped into this place. I immediately fell in love. I guess it's a coffee shop in the morning and a bar the rest of the day. Cool bar, great seating options and such, such, such a great crowd of wonderful people. Maybe I just hit them at a time when this was just what I was looking for but I was digging it. Can't wait to go back!
Sweet spot for trivia! Great drinks and a nice variety or options. Shot and a beer for $6.Trivia is on Wednesday's and gets busy fast.

I came in the afternoon, around 6-7. Looking for a place to do some work. I was a bit wary of the description mentioning a bar and glad I took the dive. They offer a very pleasant outdoor seating with a high bar and chairs that offer both street viewing and more confided space in the corner. This inside was packed with people so it had that scene of the bar to offer as well. Free WiFi as stated and they serve a mean old fashion.
This place is amazing, from its bartenders to its drinks, yum! Music has a good mix. I still find some OaKland natives here and it's just an awesome fun place!

I work in between this cafe and another and I absolutely Love room 389! The coffee is delicious every time and perfectly brewed. The food is pre packaged but great and fresh. The staff is always so friendly, I felt immediately comfortable inside my first time going. The bar seems pretty well stocked and lots of creative drink options. between this place and other coffee shops on this grand ave strip I only wanna go to 389!

I have been to this place only for the cafe drinks after running lake merritt. The offerings are pretty tasty. The chai with hemp milk is pretty awesome. The espresso and coffee drinks are fresh and hot always.  I like the concept that I can get a cafe drink with alcohol in it if I so desire. My running buddy has tried a few of their "dirty" drinks and swears they are the best! I trust her. A regular spot for sure!

A chill spot to grab a drink in oakland. I like that this place is cozy with its seating and it isn't always too crowded. They have a DJ playing music that isn't too obnoxious. Good options on cocktails and beer. It doubles as a coffee shop in the mornings. The service here is ok can get a little slow when they are busy but not terrible. All in all a nice place to stop by and grab a beer

A favorite for having a tasty bev and getting some work done. Some places shoot you nasty looks if you pull up the ol' laptop to get some work done, but not this place! They are especially teacher friendly. Lots of seating and sweet pups to pet. This place attracts nice people - the staff and the clientele. I would love to see more food options here!

This is a fun place to enjoy some music and dance or take in a beer! I enjoyed the atmosphere. There's a mixed crowd which I also appreciated. They have several beers on draft. IPA is always my choice. The space is relatively small but still enough room to dance if needed. It's loungey so there are some places to sit in a couch. Very comfy!

389 is a beautiful place to hangout and get away from the new Oakland "Tourists" that tend to congregate at places like Make Westin and Plank. Its the only bar (its also a cafe) where no cares what you do for a living or who you are. Everyone is treated in the same equal manner. Unlike some bars in Oakland where you have a definite dress code (mostly from the patrons and not the management), the REAL 389 regulars don't judge people on the superficial.Like I said, its one of the very few places you can go an weeknight or weekend evening and see the place full of people on laptops, drinking, watching sports, and just chewing the fat.The staff has always been friendly to people no matter their color or creed.And the best part is they let you bring in outside food if your hungry.

My friend from this neighborhood is a regular there and we stopped in for tacos and drinks. I love the atmosphere. It's a bit dark, so don't go there to read your Nietzsche book and look cool, but there is excellent mood lighting. Tacos were great (courtesy of the taco truck folks who enjoy an indoor, evening-residency there), bartender was hilarious and I look forward to returning. As a non-drinker, that says a lot. (There are also several classy NA-drink options for us types)

I had some time to kill before my salsa class next door. It wasn't much time so a place closeby was a must. I stumbled upon this place on a Monday night hoping for a warm drink to fight off the cold weather chills. Unfortunately the coffee bar was closed, but the bar was open for business! I thought to myself wouldn't it be fun to lose your inhibitions before a dance class? Like any bar, you had to be 21+ to enter so they check ID at the door. People under 21 are excluded, but dogs aren't! This bar is dog-friendly. I saw one inside!I asked about any happy hour deals because I had gotten there around 6:30pm. Luckily, it was $1 off drinks excluding ciders and canned beers. I decided on the Chardonnay which was amaaaazing! I had a tasting beforehand (free of charge). With tip, I only spent $6! The bartender was also pretty helpful in getting me to decide which wine to choose. The place is divey but the bar was nice. I would say there wasn't much of a crowd but let's face it, there never is on a Monday. There were sports TVs so I was able to watch a little bit of basketball too! My favorite team was playing! Overall, I enjoyed my experience at this bar/coffee shop joint (such an interesting combination). Now, I just need to come back & try their coffee!

The people that work here are amazing!!!!!This bar has got a great vibe, and a range of diversity which would typically predictably cut or divide a group and it just doesn't. Folks from all different walks of life and financial situations can enjoy each other's presence, often times doing a cheers with a stranger and staff.Did I mention the bartenders and bar backs are funny, sarcastic, intelligent mixologists and are exactly who you'd want to be staring at wondering what you want to try? Lots of new beers on tap if that's your thing, and a brand new specialty drink menu makes this spot a dog-friendly, QTPOC safe space to relax or turn up depending on the hour.

I'm sold when there are coffee cocktails. The space is really chill! Usually really good music playing and there are kind and friendly baristas and bartenders. Great space to be creative or just chill. The vibes here are great from breakfast all the way through Party time when it essentially turns into a nightclub.

Nice respite from what feels like the an ever growing divide between new yuppie hipster Oakland and the angry anti-gentrifier movement. A place that just...IS Oakland without trying to fit some label.Cocktails are a bit pricey, but well-made and served without pretension. I have had so many bad manhattans lately, I fear ordering them now. A catch22: if I have to ask to STIR and not to shake my bourbon, I sound like a jackass. If I don't, I am served a manhattan-flavored slushy and feel compelled to suck it up and drink a watery nonmanhattany smoothie.This manhattan: well balanced and stirred without having to ask, thank you cute bartender.

Cool, dark, trendy vibe. Great if your looking to set up shop at a local coffee shop. Enjoyable patio. The seats don't have backs so if your like me and perform the lumbar support it's not the ideal place. Great wifi, good coffee, $1 refills on the hot coffees, good service.  Overall 8-10

Cool groovy spot, dark inside with plenty of seating out front, bar seating, tables, and comfy seating in the back as well.  A great mix of people, very oakland, everyone friendly, and always a plus to see dogs in the bar. Fantastic cocktail menu, doing some really tasty stuff, that goes down nice and easy.  389 is the perfect spot to unwind after a long week, relax with a pre din cocktail, maybe a walk along Lake Merritt after.
Nice cocktails! Some creative stuff! Good range of beers on tap tooKind of mysterious: looks small from the street and then all of a sudden you walk in and it's a huge space

Le sigh ... really really really wish they still  had that dude come on weekdays with the awesome Congolese food smh that hot sauce and greens were everything I digress- good drinks and all , decent couch space to chill and talk to friends. Perhaps I'm ancient/aging but what's up with the new age lounge/bar/restaurants with $1.00 lighting. I'm forever using my iPhone flashlight to peruse  menus . Sexy and intimate perhaps but damn give me light POR.FAVOR.Please and thank you

There's a lot to love about 389: coffee available during the day, SPIKED coffee available during the day, friendly patrons, kind bartenders, affordable beers, and an awesome environment for watching a Warriors game. Despite it's lively evening setting, it's surprising chill - albeit a bit dark - for studying and working before 3PM.Things I like, but don't love: the food. It's good, but just a tad pricey and not as great when it's microwaved/not fresh. (Still, it rotates.) Also, if you're coming with more than one or two people, seating can be a bit difficult.Still, don't let the honest four stars fool you. This is one of my go-to's!

Long overdue review!!! ....This is my go to spot after work... and before work.... and mid day... LOL I am a hairstylist next door so I am always having their yummy coffee before work, love their quick bites to eat when I'm so starving because I forgot to book myself a lunch between clients and it is so nice to walk next door after a long day and chill with a glass of red wine, beer or a filthy martini with the regulars. This spot definitely feels like an urban CHEERS! lol  :-P I've met a lot of amazing people here! The owners are hella cool and so is the staff! Thank you guys for creating and all around great atmosphere.
Proudly my neighborhood dive bar. They allow outside food which is a huge win!
I love the 389 house coffee. The best in town. I am not a citrus coffee fan, and room 389 has a dark, robust, cinnamon-ie roast that is perfect.  I am here for my birthday coffee!

It's the ex's territory, so unfortunately I don't drop by 389 as often as I used to. But when I do, I go in head first and look both ways to make sure the scene is clear! I'm not trying to run into any mess! But once the scene is clear, I step my foot in that door and "IT'S A PARTY, IT'S A PARTY, IT'S A PARTAAAAY!" I genuinely enjoy Room 389! This is your typical neighborhood divey lounge with dim lights and bumpin' music! It's located off of Grand Ave and is super close to Lake Merritt. I've only come here during the night time, but during the day they function as a café serving brunch and coffee. I've never actually eaten here during the day, but I've heard that the food is pretty good. I will definitely need to check that out sometime in the near future. They serve up some very yummy cocktails and the atmosphere is very mellow and chill. The bartenders are generally friendly and they have a pretty good happy hour. The drinks here are decently priced compared to other bars in the area, and you can grab a nice cocktail for about $7-$8. The bar is long and beautiful! There are a few tables in the back to accommodate larger groups and this place is super dog friendly! I love coming here and seeing all of the cute pups roaming around! The crowd is very diverse and the people here are really friendly as well. It gets packed in here on Friday and Saturdays nights, and since it's small, it can get really warm. The bartenders here are pretty quick when preparing drinks though, so you won't have to wait a lifetime to start drankin'. This is a great place to come out and chill with friends and your doggies. Come to Room 389 if you are looking for a mellow bar in the Lake Merritt and Grand Ave area!
Cute hh place! Yummy basil gimlet and convenient having the taco truck right outside :).

FOR BREAKFAST/BRUNCH: the coffee is actually quite good, but do yourself a favor and stay away from the breakfast sandos/burritos; the barista just plugs them straight into the microwave. Very average. On the plus side, it's one of the few places with pour over in the neighborhood.

Room 389 is a café in the morning, and a bar at night. In the morning, they have a house-coffee, and also serve bicycle-coffee.  Bicycle coffee is the gold standard. It's local, and taste great. 389 also carries some baked goods from local bakeries in the morning.Because they are a bar, they also offer spiked coffee drinks (house whip cream) and mimosas in the morning. I believe they make a mean bloody Mary. Great for an early morning Americano. A bit of a different place in the evening.
Perfect spot to kick back and enjoy a few beers or cocktail. The ambiance is great and it always seems lively. The service can be a bit slow but honestly, it's a bar and it get's busy. I get it.

Dear 389,I typically love you for you literary decor, neighborhood spirit and delicious seasonal concoctions. But tonight, the night where I rushed to find a suitable bar to watch the redemption game of the season, the biggest game for so many of us who bleed for Oakland, you half failed me and the crowd of patrons who decided on your bar, who paid for your drinks, who inhabited your space mainly to view and listen to our Warriors playing their ultimate rivals, the Cavs. If more than one person has the guts to ask you to turn on the sound, just tonight, why can't you oblige? Are your "non sports-bar" rules so set in stone that you'd rather play your Pandora tunes than accommodate the sea of disappointed faces?!For future reference, we all know you're not a sports bar. But for your location and your sister bar, Mad Oak, please, please try to recognize the importance to the neighbors who frequent your establishments. Many of us don't have cable at home and rely on not having to bounce from bar to bar on big nights like this to get a decent show.

The vibe here is really cool. The bartenders are super nice and the drinks are delish. There was an Oakland Raiders game on while I was there, so it was cool to see that this place has a really nice Oakland pride vibe. Funky christmas lights on the walls, an oversize table lamp, and disco ball above the booths all make for a fun energy. =)

Not a huge fan.  Too long a wait standing at the bar for drinks at 5:00 on a Friday for me, though the bartender did say someone had called in sick.  Not a great Happy Hour, either, no great deals or special drinks other than well.  389 lacks personality for me.  It's not cool, or modern, or swank, or comfy, or a good dive bar, or anything in particular, for that matter.  Boy, do I miss the days of the Golden Bear.  That was something special.

Great atmosphere and friendly customer service. We came on a Monday night around 10pm, and it was full but not packed. I ordered a hot apple cider without rum, and she accidentally served me one with rum, but made up for it by promptly replacing it sans-alcohol, and giving me another one for free. There was also a great string quartet playing. Will definitely be coming back!

I always call this place 3-6-9 since I always hear Lil Jons song everytime I see the name. Anyways ...This is one of my favorite dive bars to visit whenever I'm in the area. I always go with the intention of grabbing one drink and getting a little work done, but failing at that isn't a bad thing either, especially here....  369 is a cool coffee bar in the a.m. turned solid cocktail bar in the pm with happy hour till 8, with freshly squeezed grapefruit and freshly picked herbs for your friendly poured drinks, with always a solid mix of tunes on deck, and you can even catch the game of the night on the 2 t.v's at the bar or the one in the back that feels like a seperate room that is dimly lit and one could call it a bit dungy, but is definitely loungey and chill and doubles down as a pretty cool place to decompress at the end of the day, or even a low-key spot to take a cool af chick/guy/friend who can appreciate a sick spot like this, which also by the way has a chill patio in the front where you can also knock back some fairly priced brews and enjoy the chilly nights of Oakland and look up and stare at the stars with your beautifully alcoholic glazed eyes .... sign me the f*** up! This is just the ultimate neighborhood bar. It just straight up kicks ass. I'll drink to that.

great flat white, Service-- not so much. it's a big time in the world, I know--and as I move through the day the little interactions of civility remind me of Grace.that said, as I stood across from the barista with the blank stare and rather terse disposition,  and the ready "no", and "I don't know" to the simplest question--"will you have fresh milk tomorrow"- - I thought, maybe it's me. then I found my way to another Cafe and received a lovely "good morning", and coffee made with genuine alacrity-- and I realized, yes, it IS me. I prefer Grace with my morning coffee.
The morning cafe here does an outstanding pour-over using Bicycle Coffee -- not a hint of unpleasant bitterness or burnt ash to be had in that cup. Highly recommend.
Fun place and the drinks are great! Kicked back and a perfect for low-key night or a kick start to a fun-filled night! I'll definitely be going back!

My boyfriend is a regular at 389, and since I'm a medical student on rotations that is ADDICTED to coffee, he told me they have a café I should check out. I am HOOKED. Every staff member I've encountered is absolutely welcoming and you can tell everyone enjoys their job. It has such a chill, family atmosphere. The music is always spectacular and my God, the Vietnamese blend coffee is to die for!!
The place is so chill man. Great vibe and a diverse friendly crowd. Bartenders are also attentive, fast and nice. Love this spot.
Such a chill spot. A real gem. Super knowledgable bartender Amani makes amazing cocktails. Will be back.
Great vibes, amazing coffee and really sweet staff members. I got an iced Vietnamese and a pastry and had a wonderful morning chilling on the patio.

Always appreciate a clean restroom. Positive space that welcomes daytime coffee/beer drinkers. Reasonable prices. Free wifi. Allows you to bring in outside food in a versatile environment. Beautiful set up. Convenient for busy bodies. Came here to do some research, definitely coming back to kick it- this place is legit.
a locals' spot, from what i can tell. super fun. a little loud, a little crowded. but the crowd is beautiful and the music is great.
Chill little spot that was in the area we were staying. Reasonably priced drinks and good walking distance to other restaurants and bars. Not pretentious at all, kinda divey.
Love the javi's cooking empanadas. Bartenders are ate entire during busy hours.  I enjoy their selection of beers.  Still haven't come for music or trivia but I need to.

i never use Yelp but this is my go to hang out spot when i'm in the Bay Area. i love the atmosphere and each time i come with my fiance, we are never displeased. Bartenders are very friendly and attentive and give great recomendation. it's clear they love their job. see you in two weeks, Room 389!

I came here after work while waiting for a friend to came home and sat outside. it was gorgeous out and i love their little patio. They have a small happy hour which i didn't take advantage of but the bartender was super chill, easy to talk to and attentive. They also had free wifi which was perfect. Im glad i stumbled across this place.

A classmate of mine recommended we come here to study. What a cool space! The cafe is open from 9-3 and the bar is open after. However, the cafe has a selection of boozy coffees that sound delicious. After we studied for a good bit, we decided to reward ourselves with a bloody mary ;) which were quite tasty and had a skewer or pickled veggies that went perfectly with it!Service is friendly.

Came here because I wanted to see the Giants game and do some work.  So, I went to the bar and asked for a drink.  The bartender pointed to the sign, and the bar didn't open until 3pm.  Ok.  Cool.  I saw others with drinks, but that was fine.  So, I went to the cafe side, and I asked for a latte.  Short afterwards, it came out.  It was not too bad.The ambience was pretty nice.  I liked it, but it was a little small at the bar.  There were no outlets to plug in at the tall tables and chairs.  Service was a blah.  Given that I wasn't a regular, understandable.  There were few regulars there, and that took most of the service.  I got it.  But what about the rest of the customers?  It was ok.Rating:Food: N/A.  Ambience:  3Price:  3Service:  2Overall:  2The food could be decent.  The price could be good.  But the service is the equation that makes me want to come back.  Not my type of place.
Love this spot! Great bar / cafe, lovely spot to take the missus. Very upscale and classy yet down-to-earth.

This is an awesome spot to drop in for happy hour or to watch Warriors Games. They have a cute outside patio and comfy couches in the back. I have to give an extra shout out to their bartender Mike who drove me home after I had waaay too many. He went out of his way and it was much appreciated.

#37Room 389 is so super righteous--I need to come here more often.  Early on Sunday my partner asked me if I wanted to grab a drink while we waited on a few friends to venture over from the city.  Well, I am not one to turn down a drink, especially with my S/O, so I quickly agreed.  He said he wanted the best Bloody Mary in our area and could I find the place.  I love a challenge.  I was like, "Yeah, I got you, get ready and let's go to my secret spot."  We strolled over to the bar and they were not too crowded, but it was pretty early on a Sunday morning.  There were several people on stools at the bar top and we were greeted immediately upon entry.  Room 389 has a little coffee shop in the front of the bar, and then a long, super clean bar top, a few TV's, great bartenders, a huge selection of alcohol, a stellar drink menu with throwback prices, these crazy good pretzels--it is an all around awesome spot.  The bar is really beautifully lit during the daytime with mostly natural light, and then at night it gets dark and the music is exactly what I want to hear while I am drinking with my friends.We grabbed a couple of stools and I asked my wonderful bartender, Dana, for the best Bloody Mary in Oakland.  She obliged, and I mean it really is the BEST Bloody Mary.  Hands down.  My companion went for the Brown Derby, which is a delicious cocktail with bourbon, honey, and grapefruit.  The drink was strong and delicious and only $6!  Wow--I feel like I am paying prices from the early 90's when I drink here.  Thank you Room 389 for not buying into the whole "gentrification" mode that all the other spots (that used to be cool and affordable and unpretentious--but, not anymore) have bought into in the Grand/Lake area.  What a breath of fresh air Room 389 is.We grabbed two more cocktails--yes, another perfect Bloody Mary and another amazing Brown Derby.  This time Justin, another hella cool bartender helped us out.  We even grabbed one of their famous hot, soft pretzels with mustard and salt.  It was the perfect snack for us while we waited on our friends to cross the bridge.  The service is outstanding, the atmosphere is exactly what I want in a bar and the drinks, well the drinks are straight up "wow" type drinks.  I think I fell back in love with Room 389, it has really been so long--too long--since I have hung out here.  I think we found our "new" hang out--AGAIN ;)  We loved it so much that we brought several friends in later Sunday night after dinner.  Yes, twice in one day, that is how great this place is.  Stephani Smiles for Room 389 ;)#bestbarthissideoflakemerritt
super chill neighborhood bar with great service! Great place to meet cool peeps!

2nd stop on our Monday night adventure. I've got to say, this place is coolski, I do remember when it was The Golden Bear back in the day when I was young I'm not a kid anymore. It was kind of busy for a Monday night, shout out to the bay area lushes!So yeah, it was kind of busy, The Warriors game was on, the music was chill and the bartender Greg had the libations on point phife. I would definitely go back on day they are spinning all dat wax I seented.  I am given this place 5 yums up because the dranks were on hit, the music was chill and the crowd mellow yellow tho!
I come here often for coffee in the morning and drinks in the evening. Great customer service and atmosphere.
Spiked coffee drinks! Yes please. Everyone that works here is super friendly and seems to love their job. Been a handful of times, and can not complain a bit.

Came here for happy hour yesterday. I was pleasantly surprised with the prices. Cocktails such as their greyhound were $5 and their beers were $4. The greyhound was pretty good. It wasn't sour from the grapefruit, but it could have used more alcohol. Room 389 has a chill ambience. Not too loud but you don't need to watch yourself with how loud you're talking. It is also dog friendly so feel free to bring your dog while you hang out with friends over some drinks. They accept all sorts of payment too which is nice :] No need to worry about bringing cash.
The people who work here are fantastic! We just stopped in for a cup of tea, but it's also a bar.

To be honest, I didn't eat or drink at Room 389.  Unfortunately while I was waiting, a huge dog strolled down the aisle towards the bar.  Total turn off for me.  I don't think I can ever erase that image from my mind.  My bad.... I didn't know the bar was dog friendly.
