Went on a Monday night when they had live music. It was a really chill atmosphere and a couple of girls were freely dancing to the bossa nova beats. Waited longer than expected to order drinks. Not sure if it was two bartenders or one bartender and a bar back, but it took some staring down to convey to them we wanted to order some drinks. The drinks were strong and made with freshly squeezed grapefruit juice- which is of course a plus. Overall good vibe, I'd like to come back for early coffee and their fresh pressed juices.

Came on Saturday night. Mike and Justin are the BEST, friendliest  bartenders.  Even Tylor the barback was super attentive for no server and our group really appreciated it!  Will definitely be back again!

I really don't understand this place. They don't have food. They charge $2 for essentially Chex mix. And the service is awful. I have to work outside of my apartment so I can focus. I might be one person, but I've had enough jobs in the service industry that I will always leave a more than generous tip. ALWAYS. Because I know the cost of living is ridiculous and understand all of the things that go along with working in the industry Unless you are bad at your job, then the standard tip will occur. So I have been here too many times and tonight was the final straw. I walked inside with my backpack as I planned on getting some coffee and the ridiculous Chex mix to sit outside so I'm not taking away from patrons that will likely spend more money than me. I waited over 8 minutes at the bar. Not ONE person came to take an order from me. Nope. And I know that it was 8 minutes because the NO vs OKC basketball game was on. I watched at least 6 other people receive service while I was there, waiting, as patiently as humanly possible. But I had things to do. Grabbed my stuff and left to spend my money elsewhere.
According to a certain bartender after 6:30p they don't have wifi. WTF?? Is it costing you bro?

This place is great. Relaxing, beautiful, cool vibe. I came here for a birthday once and it was a blast, and the bartender gave me special drinks. It's also great to come during the day to get work done. One of my favorite spots in Oakland.

I've been here a few times and every time I enjoy myself. By day they serve cafe style; baked goods and bicycle coffee, early evening and night time you'll see a crowd outside on the patio with drinks in hand. 389 is just outside Lake Merritt. With a huge patio and a lounge like interior, this spot appeals to everyone. Like I stated early they have a full espresso machine, drip coffee and are now serving breakfast burritos! I stopped in for their Spiked Coffee Beverages. I've been eyeballing these guys every visit. Mid afternoon it was so a took a seat outside on the patio, where there is a convenient window opening to the bar through which the bartender can serve your drinks. After asking the Barista which drink she recommended I decided on the Kraken Chai and might I say it was "CRACCKKKKIIINNNNG" I loved it. Weary of mixed coffee drinks because they are usually made with milk , I was pleasantly surprised by the strength of the alcohol and the lack of milk. HORRAY!!!389 is a perfect spot to meet up with friends. It's a nice alternative to the coffee shop scene of you wanna do some work on their Wifi network. They serve food and good vibes. I'll be back for another Chai soon.

Love this place. Love the decor beyond the raggedy seats and sofas. Great service in all visits thus far. Drinks a perfectly poured and they have fresh squeezed grapefruit, which is a plus. Totally dig this spot

Very best greyhounds and basil minty cocktail things in the world!  I adore the ambiance, great group of bartenders, perfect happy hour!  I do wish they had food but they allow you to bring outside food in.  One of my favorite spots!

This place could be in between 3 to 5 stars that what kind of night you can have! I found the vibe is always chill, the conversation is always smooth, the drinks are super effective. You may find yourself saying "How did I get here?" You may find yourself in a great conversation? It is a great place to be conspicuous and inconspicuous... "That's me in the corner, that's me in the spotlight" Yes you can lose your religion here, you might meet your wife or husband here? You might walk Lake Merritt drunk and tipsy or find yourself under the stars on the Fairyland lawn?You might loose your wallet and have it returned to you by a nice gentleman or gentlewomen.. You might start drink coffee here in the day and drink beer at night?The possibilities are endless at 389 basically you might go there tonight? You might go there tomorrow, but basically just go!

I came here during the late afternoon on a Saturday with a few of my friends. It looked like a nice place inside and out. The bartender was nice and there was comfortable seating.Unfortunately, they really fell short with the drinks. One of my friends ordered a bottled cider -- that was no problem. Another ordered PBR and tequila, but the can of PBR was warm. The last two of us ordered house cocktails that contained grapefruit juice. The resulting drinks tasted alright, but were in serious need of a strainer. Both were filled with tons of seeds and pulp that blocked the straws and made them difficult and unpleasant to drink. It almost seemed like it was made with a wedge of muddled grapefruit and then garnished with seeds.I've heard good things about this bar, and it has good reviews on Yelp. I'd like to think that this was just an off-day, or that their strainer has a big hole in it and they just haven't realized it yet.
I've passed this place a thousand times and finally came in for trivia night. Nice venue, trivia was really fun, and they're dog friendly.  They also have a nice selection of cocktails and wine.

Great neighborhood bar and friendly place to pop in for a drink, prices are very reasonable too - I can't think of many loungy bars that are as reasonable. Icing on the cake though is that they are dog friendly!It would be a 5* rating, but they don't serve food, so not a place I could stay at for more than an hour or two.

Ordered and was given one price then total was different. Though it didn't occur to me until after I paid, they defended the bartender and refused to reimburse me. Normally, wouldn't fuss about it but it bothered me that the owner was adamant it was my mistake. Not sure if I'll be back here.

Stood at the bar for OVER 10 MINUTES. As a former bar back and waiter, I can tell you making a new customer wait at the bar like that is absolutely unprofessional and rude.On top  of that their LOSING MONEY. I was willing to buy at least a few drinks and tip appropriately. So bartenders... whether your having a bad day or have some weird psychotic vendetta against random people that come in for a drink; serve them. Because in the end your losing money and reputation. And those are necessities for a restaurant to survive.
Good place to watch sporting events. Cool peeps. Not down with allowing all dogs in the place.
The bar tender Greg is awesome. Knows his drinks and gives good recommendations. Also the barback with the glasses is adorable

Room 389 is hands down one of my favorite hang outs. The cinnamon-infused extra dark coffee is unparalleled (to a true coffee aficionado) and their greyhounds with fresh grapefruit juice hit the spot every time. The general vibe is really welcoming and it's a perfect neighborhood bar.

This place is a nice lil' (li'l'?) spot to get a drink and potentially an empanada--although I have yet to succumb to the latter; so I can't recommend those just yet. The crowd is mixed but usually pretty typical of the Lakeshore/Grand area: mid- to upper-30s, blazers with jeans, that kind of thing. It's small and there's a patio kind of thing out front designated for you to smoke and irritate those walking down Grand with obnoxious sounds or whatever you and your crew get into when you're drunk. I'm not here to judge. The bathroom is pretty clean and on the weeknights that my friends and I have stopped in, we've been able to find seating downstairs on the couches but rarely at the barstools or any of the tables adjacent to the bar near the entrance. Upstairs seems all cool and shrouded in mystery like your parents' upbringing but that's probably because every time I've ventured up there I've been told to skedaddle because that area is supposedly ALWAYS reserved, even on the deadest Wednesday known to man. I mean duh. This is Room 389 we're talking about! But I don't mind, as long as you guys keep a big, comfy couch for me to sashay to and fro' and a cold drink for me to set down once I'm seated. Cheers!

$6 fresh squeezed Greyhound?! Dog friendly besides 10pm -1am on the weekends?! Need I say more?! I am always on the lookout for a good bar that is dog friendly. Especially one that is dog friendly INSIDE.  This is now my neighborhood bar since we recently moved to the Adams Point area of Oakland. This place can get crazy crowded on weekend evenings and it sometimes takes a while to get a drink, but otherwise it is pretty flawless in my opinion.

This is my go-to neighborhood weekend hang-out.  And I guess I'm a regular now because two of the bartenders always know what I'm going to order: the Eric Estrada (awesome spicy tequila cocktail).  They have other great drinks as well, but I can't not order the Estrada, it's just too damn good.  Earlier in the afternoon, the atmosphere is very chill.  I usually come in at around 2:00 PM on Saturdays and Sundays and hang out in the back for a few hours with my laptop, getting work done.  The place gets pretty packed later on in the day, especially if there is a big game on TV.  It is actually a great place to watch a game if you get there early enough to get a good seat.  But I mainly come here for the non-busy hours, when it is my perfect blend of coffee-house and cocktail bar.

I can't comment on this places quality as a bar but it was very disappointing as a cafe. I ordered a cappuccino and it came out warm, at best, with almost no foam. I love a room temperature latte as much as the next guy but it's would be great if I could actually receive what I ordered.

TL;DR: i went for coffee and a pastry -- very cute, good coffeethe ambiance is cozy, very woodsy. coffee is gooood.pastries were good. we didn't try anything crazy so it wasn't like blow-your-mind, just good quality stuff. i recommend this place for a coffee chat with a friend/bf. the ambiance makes you feel important.

Comfortable bar that seems to attract 25 to 35 year old people on the Thursday night that I was there. Looks beautiful and clean inside and out if you were wondering about how to put your old crappy books to good use check out their walls - unique and practical insulation. Polite crowd but to get a drink at the bar might take a while.... but hey, if your at a bar your probably looking to kill time anyway.
Love this place...great drinks, good music, and cozy yet spacious if that makes sense. Had my b-day party here and there were no problems.

OK! I have held back any negative opinions of 389 for one reason only...ITS A FREAKING GREAT PLACE to socialize with your friends or mix in an interestingly diverse crowd from many backgrounds, etc and I generally have a great time when I am there. However there is one annoying consistency..the staff are hit or miss. Some of the them are great or warmer since they've come to recognize me and others are often unfriendly. But one of the girls working the cafe is the worst offender. No matter how great I feel when I leave my apt seeing her ruins my mood. Ive tried to go in with a new attitude thinking maybe I am doing something to turn her off, although the onus is usually on the establishment to make the customer feel comfortable and not the other way around. Nothing ive tried helps. Its frustrating..so much so that I felt compelled to write a negative review about one of my favorite places.
I LOVE this place. I've only been for coffee, but it's been tasty every time. I like the comfortable atmosphere and the wall of books ^_^ I can't wait to finally go during bar hours.
I love this place! Great beats, great drinks, great trivia, great sports! No cover, either. Be careful when pouring the first glass off their pitchers, though...

I really wanted to like this place, as I gave it a 2nd try. The first time I went, it wasn't bad at all. I like the decor, lighting is good and it's clean. See, I don't ask for much! Both times I wasn't a fan of the doorman's behavior towards me, but I know he can't be Mr. Rogers around drunk people. So not too big of a fault there. But I decided to spend my birthday here last night. Both times the drinks were ok, but I'd much rather just get the Deschutes Porter. My Old Fashioned was a bit too sweet, but I can accept that. Here is where I went sour: After having my one drink I was cut off because Mr. Ponytail thought I was driving drunk. Plot twist: I WASN'T DRIVING! I just wanted a simple birthday drink. He got mad and began ranting to the whole bar. I'm an understanding guy, so I can only guess maybe drunk driving had a personal effect on him and I was a bystander. Sorry 389, I really wanted this to be my spot. Back to 3411!

Hands down one of the best bars in Oakland! Room 389... where to start? What continually draws me back to this place is definitely the environment. Above all, the people that come here are chill. Even on a busy night, the crowd keeps things cool and its relatively easy to get a drink without bumping elbows. I also like that the crowd age is mixed well between older millennials and middle age people. You certainly will not find an excess of young debauchery like some spots in uptown.  This is also one of my go-to spots for watching sports games. Order your favorite delivery and have it sent to the bar. Outside food is not frowned upon which I think is pretty great.
Great neighborhood bar with a relaxed vibe. Their cocktails are not my favorite, but I go for the atmosphere anyways.
Bar is great. Atmosphere is amazing. Bartenders are hit or miss. Either 5 star or 3 star. Door guy sucks. Rude and not considerate or attentive at all. Bar manager is cool. Does a great job.
Im falling for this Eric Estrada tequila drink, thus: four starsPoor phone reception BUT the outdoor patio in front is nice and its dog-friendly
Super friendly bartenders, strong drinks at a reasonable price, and good vibes all around. I'll be back!

This is my ABSOLUTE favorite bar to come to when I want to just hang out and chill with my friends.  The atmosphere is incredible, the people who go there are fun and super friendly, and I always get more than what I expect in service from the staff. I never hesitate to mention this bar when people ask me for suggestions on where they can go for great service, good drinks, awesome music and an incredible vibe....this is definitely the spot to be at!  Oh, and the food is great too. I wish the cafe stayed open longer than it does. But worth it if you have a chance to get in there before it closes up for the afternoon.

Favorite bar in Oakland! Drinks are always on point and great selection of spirits. I also love that DJs play vinyl, no exceptions! The decor is nicely done. From the light fixtures to the book page wall decor. The carved woodwork in the back is stunning. Feels like home. It's pretty much my second home. My bf DJs here every 3rd Saturday of the month. Wax Works! Ambiance is bitchin' with people dancing. The staff are all friendly and awesome especially the dancing barback/busser! Even though I usually stick with my whiskey neat. I occasionally will try their craft cocktails and I've yet to be disappointed. The pours are heavy and drinks are always tasty. Fresh squeezed juices to mix and fresh garnishes. They also make a killer bloody mary!!! Oh and the bar doubles as a cafe. It's a trip how different it is in there in the morning with people on their laptops just like any other coffee shop. So calm and quiet before the storm of afternoon lushes. But what makes their little cafe kick ass is because they offer spiked chai tea lattes and coffees! Yep! That's what I call a proper morning pick-me-upper!

I was here on a couple of occasions to get drinks or a coffee with friends. But the best time I had so far was on Superbowl Sunday in 2015. I wasn't feeling well enough to make the trek to SF and happen to live nearby, so I stopped in for a beer and ended up staying for the whole game. What's more, the people here were very friendly and jovial and I ended up chatting with quite a few and forgetting that I was miserable earlier that morning. This is totally a neighborhood gem and I'm so lucky to live within walking distance.
Awesome local bar.  Great balance of people and drinks.  A huge fan of Wednesday Trivia with Chuck. Gets hella crowded though.

I'd say this is one of my all time favorite bars with a great mix of people and awesome chill Oakland vibes.  The happy hour is really long, 3-8pm every day.  Their bloody mary is one of the best with lots of tasty snacks for garnish.  I think this has left me spoiled and no other bloody has lived up to this since trying it here.  There's lots of comfy seating toward the back along with a patio out front for smokers.  I love that they have a full service café serving coffee, tea, and spiked coffee drinks.  The trivia night on Wednesdays is really fun although it's super packed and kind of difficult to hear the questions.

First time here was for the 2014 World Cup, Loved every minute of being there to the point that we came back later that night for Bar Trivia!Great People, Great Atmosphere, Great Drinks. Hungry? Ask for the Empenadas(sp?)Helpful? click the [Helpful] button below
Got to love this spot. Vibes are crazy cozy, the coffee is FK#$% legit, you can even spike it!!! Service is pleasant, been my local spot on many a bad nights and brought me back up to elevation.

This place is my go-to when I am craving hot chocolate. Not only do they offer a variety of coffee drinks, they also have a variety of pastries. My usual order consists of Mexican Hot Chocolate (hot chocolate and cinnamon!) and an almond pastry. Divine. I think the best part is the barista. She is always smiling and happy. She even makes cute little designs in the foam of our drinks. She is the best!

Great service in here all the time. I didn't enjoy the coffee or latte that much. But the drinks mainly the greyhound is awesome. The fresh grapefruit juice makes the difference and I've asked other places but they don't have fresh squeezed juice. Great atmosphere with a laid back vibe. I wish they played different music at times but overall a great place to hang and drink. Good happy hour  prices!

This is my go-to neighborhood bar and sometimes coffee shop. Decent beer selection and good cocktails, plus a great long happy hour. Tasty coffee drinks/Irish coffee + free wi-fi for the afternoon. A few big TVs for sports if that's your thing. 3-4 different areas to sit depending on your mood or group. Super-fun trivia night on Wednesday. Love the torn books on the wall, the ambiance, and the attitude. About as chill as it gets.
Used to be a fun please to go. Beware of what you order on your open tab, they tend to overcharge, happened to me twice and also to some friends.
Best hot toddy, cozy place to come and listen to live music. Perfect for rainy days in Oakland.
Love love this palce. Cozy ambiance and great mix drinks. I also love it is a couple of blocks from my apartment.

The boyfriend and I were looking for a breakfast/lunch place to grab a quick snack before running around town. Upon entering, we saw the small empanada menu at the front and a variety of drink offerings up on the chalkboard. The entire menu looked awesome but we decided on one empanada and one tamale (I have a serious addiction) in addition to an iced coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice. The coffee was so delicious that I only added a little cream (and that says a lot) and the juice was sweet and tart. The empanada....I managed to get one bite from the boyfriend before he completely inhaled it. The pork was perfectly seasoned with the outside crispy and flaky. The tamale was equally tasty and had more filling than masa, which is a good sign. I wish I could have gone back and tried more but the next time that I am in Oakland, this is my first stop!

Bars are popping up everywhere around Oakland, which is great. Still, 389 is the go-to spot. There is just something about this place. The decor is great and the cocktails are solid. And the beat part the diversity, which you simply can't find in most places (especially in SF).
- coffee and cocktails in one place!- good relaxed vibe- great location near lake merritt

There is no more Tuesday African food. Stopped back in September or so. Nonetheless, chill vibe, good music, cheap drinks and they allow dogs. Plus they have tv screens to watch all the sporting events. The loss of the African food is huge but still worth a night out.

Handmade Empanadas are amazing at this spot. Truly a hidden gem with a great local scene. Bar service is great and well priced.happy hour everyday of the week and is a great place to kick back after work.They also host a pretty fun trivia night however it gets pretty loud and hard to hear the questions...

This place is not bad. Parking in the area is little tough if you want to avoid the meters. Some negatives: bad cell service, and I didn't like that they left the doors opened, while people in front smoked cigarettes. The proximity to the lake just blows all the smoke into the bar. Positives: lots of beer and cocktail choices. Even my hard to find Peak's Organic on tap. This place also has coffee and some food as well. Overall, good layout of choices.  Note, only beers are on HH.
Solid music, and even better beer selection! Although the crowd can be a little older, its still the best bar around Lake Merritt. Most likely going to be a neighborhood go-to!

nice local place with great blood mary's.  watched several world cup matches there.....not at their best ..... slow lackisdaisical service when all you want is to get your drink or coffee and get back to the match.....still a nice place just weren't a 100% during world cup
Good selection of drinks, good beers on tap (local and otherwise,) friendly service, Caribbean food some nights and event trivia! I love this bar. They even have a cafe during the day time.

Perhaps my favorite bar. Watched USA Belgium here, very appropriate place. Great drinks, they make amazing coffee too, very easy, close to everything. Gotta hand it to Bar 389, they have been my most solid option in this neighborhood for quite some time.
I love their cafe. Their coffee was delicious and so was their pastries. The pastry I ate had almond and chocolates. So goood!
Their happy hour goes until 8 p.m., making it one commuters can actually take advantage of. Couple that with friendly bartenders, good coffee, and kickass empanadas, and you have a great night,
A nice, upscale, dive-ish bar where you can actually get service. Not my favorite, but I'd go again!
Jaime's Old Old Fashioned w/ Templeton Rye.  THE BEST!Tamales! Line 51.

It's unfortunate that the bartender has such a pompous attitude especially when the bar is half empty. Last night was the 2nd time I've experienced horrible service from him. Good music, great people, but a demeaning vibe from the bartender. God forbid you ask him a question about a drink and are a woman.
This place is cool. Bartenders are friendly and I like the environment. I wish they have more food option.

Pretty cool bar with great and friendly bartenders. Their happy hour drink selections are great and plentiful. Their tequila shots are cheap ($4/each), though I don't remember what kind they use. Plenty of seating and tables and the environment is pretty chill.

Room 389 quickly became one of my favorite spots and there are many things to love about it. First, they have Thelonius on tap! One of my favorite brews and I rarely see it at a bar at all so the fact that it's on tap makes it even better! Second, the drinks are consistently strong and high quality. My two faves are the Grand Hound (better than The Layover's greyhound) with not just vodka and fresh grapefruit but splashes of a couple other liqueurs that go great with citrus, and the Eric Estrada,refreshing because of the cucumber but a little dash of spicy-ness adds a great element. Third, the bartenders are always nice a take care of the regulars first!Last, the DJs play actual records! And the beats are always hot on weekend nights. If you're not at 389 right now, go!

This little hidden gem in the Oakland lake shore area , caters to the local hipsters , guests , San Franciscans , and then some. The welcoming environment boasts high quality drinks, friendly bar tenders , and and an extra shot on your drink if you ask nicely . Great vibe, and good lookin' male population of the black persuasion.

Short and sweet. Great bar tenders & awesome baristas at the cafe. Love the coffee, super juice, drink menu, empanadas and bacon bloody Mary's weekend mornings! Morning, noon, and night, 389 is there for me! Also dog friendly!

Bar/I love this place, but the acoustics are so bad that even with 10 people in there during the evening, I have to almost yell in order to hear myself talk.  Otherwise, fun place.  Maybe good to go when you're already buzzed.Cafe/Love it.  Could get some better pastry, and charge a bit less for the tamales and quiche, which run $5.00.  I love the dark atmosphere, unlike most cafe's that are lit up and noisy.  Not here.  Also, It's great to have a place nearby that has good coffee, good  staff, and is not taken over by the bacon/pbr set, yet.  And they allow dogs!!!!  Excellent.All in all, mad props to the owner(s) for finding a way to utilize a bar space during the hours when they'd otherwise be making minimal cash.  nice job.

Room 389 strikes the perfect balance between too-cool hipster bar and laid-back dive. They've got a little bit of everything with the mini garden-like patio in front, long bar, and loungey area in back. So, if you feel like going out but don't want to make a big deal of it, 389 is kind of perfect. Cocktails are fab, and (little known fact) during the day the space operates as a cafe with the usual coffeeshop goods AND made-to-order green juice. So you can detox by day, retox by night. Get the apple purée & egg white cocktail! It's a guzzler.They have a trivia night on Wednesdays, which seems to be pretty popular (but doesn't take itself nearly as seriously as other trivia nights...watch out for cell phone cheaters). I've never had a bad time here, thanks to the strong drinks and chill crowd. Check it!
A solid selection of brews on tap, friendly bartenders, good music, and a chill atmosphere makes 389 one of my favorites bars in Oakland.

Room 389: Step into another world that is different outside of Oakland! Come take a walk into a bar that gives you the feel of being in a New Orleans, meets Jamaica and a bar in BARbados. Its a friendly neighborhood bar that can feel like a short vacation from the urban, busy and fast paced life, where adults of different ages come here for a shot and a beer or a tropical/craft cocktail.Service: Bartenders are no frills and thrills type of people, they love both pouring beers and shaking up cocktails. It is not pretentious like bars in SF, where cocktails are $14, here they are fairly priced from $9-$11. Even during a busy happy hour and with a game on TV, there bartenders are always ready to shake or pour your booze. Highlights: Old Fashioned: I hold my standards high for Old Fashioned, and here they make it simple and right. Not too sweet, not to bitter and has the perfect kick with Buffalo Trace Bourbon. Irish Coffee: One of the best that I have tried! They use bicycle coffee and a generous amount of Whiskey that can either stimulate or depress your nerves. Also, even better they serve it topped with caramel whipped cream made in house.
Props to Cooper for reminding me of happy hour pricing and for giving a great pour. Room 389 is my neighborhood joint, and I might even start working out of here as an office in the mornings. Gulp!

If I were going to design a local from scratch, I'm not sure I'd need to, because I could just start with Room 389 and maybe add a touch more ventilation (the place can get pretty stuffy, especially when it's warm out).Short walk from home? Check.Interesting mix of people? Check.Chill vibe?  Check.Daily happy hour with sweet deals? Check.Heavy handed-bartenders on those happy hour well drinks? Check.Only craft brew and Guinness on tap? Check.Brother Thelonious? Check.TVs if I wanna glance up at a game from time to time? Check.Couches if I want to lounge more? Check.All in all it's pretty much got all I want and nothing I don't.

I like this place... been here a few times and I've always enjoyed the atmosphere and the patrons. The bar is stocked proper, with great whiskey's, specialty drinks made by good bartenders and there's also a coffee shop at the front. There's food to boot (which I here is actually quite tasty). They have drink specials, which is right up my alley as well as a DJ on some nights. The vibe is chill with what seems to be mainly locals. Dancing happens! The clientele is mixed, diverse, from super drunks to the proper types - black to white old to new. I dig that... However, I did get crap from some weirdo lady for rocking my Dodger cap in there once. She was a bit drunk and kind of played herself because there were tons of local macho dudes around to back her up but they played it cool and ignored the whole incident. Bravo, macho dudes.Oakland and SF have tons of great bars and this one holds it's own against them all.

When it comes to bars, I usually have a strict criteria:  Booze and music.   These guys nail it when it comes to both.   On every weds they have trivia night which gets super packed but really enjoyable!  Drinks are also well made and bartenders simply don't just pour.  During the daytime it's a cafe where they have a full espresso bar and pastries.  Not to mention they have spiked drinks as well...woohoo!
Nice local bar, good size, but crowded nights can make it very noisy.

Nighttime or late weekend afternoons is the time to be at 389 Grand. There is good music and a good crowd at this local style bar. I am not a huge fan of the design of the place, the seating and the lack of good lighting, makes me feel like I do not want to stay for a long time. Its not bad just could be better. Wednesday night trivia is fun.However, I am not impressed at all by the cafe in the morning. There is no real food or pastries, there is a so-so tasting quiche and muffins usually. I am not sure why but it takes forever to get my drink too.

I can only review their espresso, and it was bad. It tasted like they'd brewed really strong Folger's. Disappointing. Other than that, the decor is funky chic and the ambiance was pleasant. But I go to coffee houses primarily for the coffee, so I doubt I'll be back.
Fav go to local bar; the dj's spin chill music and it's never too long of a wait for a freshly pressed grey hound!

What a cute little place! I really like the decor here, which gives it a nice personal touch.I came here on a rainy day for some coffee with a friend. It wasn't overly crowded on a Saturday, and it was a cozy place to settle in at for a few hours. I would definitely come back on a weekday evening or weekend night to see how the scene changes.The staff was friendly and the drinks were good. I'll be back.

My local bar. I've lived in the neighborhood for 3 years; love this place.  * trivia night: fun and run by the same man who does trivia at Cato's Ale House (piedmont) and other local trivia nights. He's the master! * Bartenders are friendly, efficient, and not snobby at all,  The ONLY time I had trouble getting service was election night/watching the returns, and that's because they were  offering free shots for every state Obama won. Also, they had guest bartenders that night.* This spot is a café by day.The couches transform into a place to work with your laptop rather than flirt over beers. I will sometimes get a pour-over coffee and a tamale in the morning. They also offer small pastries. * Parking is hard to come by (that goes for the whole neighborhood, actually). Limited street parking is usually available after several passes around the block. I always walk, but friends have had a hard time parking nearby.

Eight years ago, I ate the most heavenly vegan Cameroonian food. It was at a small place in Berkeley. I just moved back to the Bay and hunted this food down. The guy is now serving on Tuesday nights at Room 389. I told a friend, "let's go there" and we did.First of all, the bar was great. Great ambiance, decor. The happy hour was great. $4 for well drinks. The bartenders were definitely at different skill levels. I ordered a whiskey sour and the first one I got was a whiskey and water. I didn't drink it and got it remade. The second time around it was good... and the third was AMAZING. There is one bartender who has the perfect hand with a drink. If I knew the names, I would totally say it here... cause his drinks were spot on.After hanging out for a bit, the guy with the Cameroonian food came in. He had a veggie combo, chicken combo, and fish combo. I tried the veggie combo ($10) and my friend tried the chicken combo ($12). Both were AMAZING! Whatever he put on the plate was magic. Spicy and flavorful and pure deliciousness.Definitely coming back on another Tuesday night... this might become a thing for me!Go... and bring cash for that food... totally worth it!
Service is really nice, I love the later in the week night crowd. It can get a little busy, but it's worth the wait.

Perfect neighborhood bar less than a block away from the Lake. Not sure what took me so long to test it out but I'll definitely find my way back soon to test out the lovely sectionals in the back of the bar.

Great local bar Oakland owned and operated.  It's always busy and interesting here.  The drinks are good and reasonably priced and there is usually some sort of rotating food available from neighborhood vendors.  Trivia night is more fun than most places, I think.  Bartenders are really nice here, too, which matters to me.
Pretty much my neighborhood bar. Feel free to stalk me here.

From my coffee in the morning to my freshly squeezed gray hound in the evening, this place has it going on. The bar tenders are great, the drinks are strong, and the crowd is a unpretentious mix of folks just out to have a good time. I often spend my "work from home" days here as they have free wi-fi...and hey, I don't have to go anywhere for happy hour. Also spend lots of Sundays here cheering with the usual Sunday football crowd. No kitchen, but they are cool with you bringing food in or having it delivered. Ample street parking.

This place was a treat. I walked in because their sign displayed "Hot Buttered Rum". I asked the cashier if it was actually good. She said it was delicious and I was not disappointed. It was amazingly good topped with a salted caramel thick house whipped cream. It was 10 bucks but worth it for a "treat yo self" day. Also ordered a tamale which are vegetarian: super good flavors. I didn't give five stars because the atmosphere was confusing. There was weird music, sports on, but with a Caribbean explorer flare? That side I'd go back.

I ordered a latte here today and was pleased by its quality. They used a good brand of soy milk and steamed it well. Lots of seating to choose from. One of my only concerns was that the lighting may be too dim, but there are several better lit places to sit. The dim lighting adds to its charms.Great place. I'll be here again.

Cafe by day, bar by night. My hipster musician friend brought me to this spot last night at midnight:30 and I had two of the best mojitos I've had in a long time. One of the walls was covered in pages from books and there was interesting lamps along the bar top. The loungey area in the back was cozy and near the DJ booth which was playing on a Thursday night. I liked the way the bathroom doors were constructed. I'll have to upload a picture, I know it sounds weird but it felt really medieval sitting on the pot :).

I just received a message from the owner/manager of Room 389 saying that they have installed grab bars in their restroom. I have yet to see it for myself so just 4 stars for now but the next time I get over to the neighborhood I will definitely check it out. Thank you Room 389 for thinking of all your customers!
One of my favorite hangouts. Awesome beer (only 9 on tap but good options) LOVE the bartenders and the atmosphere and music is perfect.

Awesome little spot, just tucked away. The drinks here are great, not cheap by any means their cocktails are pretty creative and their bartenders are super friendly and nice and go out of their way to help ya. I was like surprised by it when I went in. The atmosphere is pretty cool and lounge in the back with good music and the front has open space to stand and some tall tables with bar stools. The bouncers look pretty sharp and are also nice guys. Haven't tried the food but I'd venture it's prob good too.

I've tried this spot over and over again because people I know seem to like it and it's very close to home but I can't get into it. The set up is not very conducive to meeting others in my opinion. I dunno perhaps the lack of standing room and how divided each table is. Not sure how to explain. Then the service is kinda sucky. Just never get a good vibe from the bar tenders except one time this guy was overly happy almost pushing the weird line. There's also no bar food. They let you order from places near by but those places are not the best. The drinks are just OK.  I'm sure I'll try again but I think I'm more for 355.
Best bloody mary in the east bay.  Nuff said. :D

Great place and som of the best prepared drinks in the bay. You must try the greyhound! Great staff with lots of drinks knowledge. The only problem is that when it gets any sort of full it gets warm in the back. They have a nice patio in the front of the bar that closes at 10pm , and the is fresh homemade food served  st the bar several nights a week. During the day 389 opens as a cafe. There is internet coffee and pasties.
This place is addicting. I met a boxer there. His name was Rusty. A dog boxer. lIke really.....a fly ass bar that lets you bring well mannered animals. This place is all that

Excellent little neighborhood bar with Brother Thelonious on tap!  There's even a decent Indian place (cheap!) next door that will deliver your order (free!) to you while you sit and drink beers with your friends.  Very relaxed and enjoyable - looking forward to visiting with friends there again soon!

Oldies night. Pretty chill bar & lounge. They definitely need more air circulation in here though. The bartenders were pretty cool. One of them gave my friend and I a free little bottle of Ginger Beer or something.  It was pretty disgusting, but that was nice of him.  There's couch seating in the back where the DJ is spinning and seating with tables along the wall throughout the bar.  It's a pretty small place, but it was a decent bar/lounge. Not exactly a place I'd be into going to all the time, but it was nice for a one-time thing for me.  It was mostly a crowd of people in their 30s it seemed.

I love this bar!  If you're looking for a chill spot to watch a game, play some bones or just chat with your neighbor, this is the spot to check out.  Great whiskey selection. Decent beers on tap. Delicious food on Wednesdays - their pork sandwich w/ chicharones was heavenly (honest). Always love the music the DJ plays in the evenings.Only con - the service can be slow.  They guys are nice & make a great drinks, but they're not the speediest.

I discovered this bar since I was getting a tattoo consult across from Old Crow.The bartenders are so nice. Mike is the best! Hassani too. The atmosphere is just friendly. Even the women that you think are gonna be bitches, are actually nice.We love Tuesdays cuz there's a guy from Camaroon who brings his delicious cooking! Cash only but it's a generous helping. Between me and my girl, we still couldnt finish it! I love that they freshly squeeze the grapefruit for the drinks! Yay! I found a place to be an alcoholic at! Well, especially that the happy hour is till 8:)

Okay, I've been feeling much better about this place. Instead of the two guys who were tending bar when I last reviewed, there has been a skinnier, younger guy and there was a young girl yesterday. And THEY ARE GREAT. They make eye contact, they smile, make small talk, they're on the ball about waiting customers-- basically, they do what bartenders are supposed to, and frankly, that's all I ask. Further, the fact that they let me bring my snuggle bunny dog (and the bartenders and patrons alike are super-sweet to her) AND my own food from the Mex joint across the street makes me lovelovelove them. We will go back, again and again. And probably again. Also, they have playing cards- hallelujah!
I love this place for it atmosphere and great drinks.  This vibe is always chill and everyone is super friendly.  Tuesdays are a must for the West African soul food, yum.

Great atmosphere. I went in the afternoon with a friend, and it was nice and laid back. I had the Vietnamese iced coffee. I was surprised it didn't come with a container that allows the coffee to drip. Other than that though, it was great!
Simply... This is a really good bar. My favorite on the lake. Prohibition Sour? Yes please! You can take anyone to this fine tavern and enjoy yourself. Cheers!

Desperately needed coffee while the boyfriend was getting his haircut nearby.. Almost went next door but yelp pointed me over here. COMPLETELY doesn't match the rest of grand ave but it's beautiful on the inside.. Reminded me of a sultry Havana cafe in Puerto Rico. I haven't had Vietnamese coffee anywhere but a smallPho joint I go to because it's usually not too great. The viet coffee here was delicious, not too sweet or creamy with the perfect flavor of condensed milk. I dinked off one stat because I'm a HUGE stickler for politeness and smiley attitudes from employees and unfortunately the person who helped me seemed irritated, didn't say thank you or you're welcome and almost seemed mad that I didn't have the money immediately (had to dig for another dollar)

I really like this place.It's become my default café and bar -- which is actually saying quite a lot, since I'm not the type to have a default joint. Coffee drinks are well made here. It's great to segue from studying in the afternoon to drinking in the afternoon -- or, combine the two and get a spiked coffee. Room 389 is pretty much the only reason I manage to study on a Sunday.Staff is friendly, the crowd is diverse but open. In true Oakland style, you get a real cross-section of people intermingling here. I love the vibe of the place when it's quieter, but never mind it as it starts to pick up. People are friendly and no one hassles you.

***This review is specifically about Tuesday nights - I have opinions on other nights but want to keep this one focused.***Tuesday night is African Food Night - well that's what people call it but it's specifically Cameroonian Food Night. The food is prepared by Chef Malong Pendar and he's amazing! The food is AMAZING - so flavorful. When you walk into Room 389 just go toward the back and his station is just before the DJ booth. Side note: the water is located near the front door and you'll need water if you order his hot sauce.The options are chicken, fish, or vegetarian. I went with chicken, so juicy! There was also spinach, rice, and yams. There was something else that was amazing but I couldn't hear what he said. The plate is only $12 you pay in cash & it's heaping! Could easily feed 2 people. Quite a few people would eat then ask for foil to cover the plate & bring it home. A few warnings: 1) When Pendar says his hot sauce is "for professionals only" he means it - HOT HOT HOT but delicious 2) bring cash 3) prepare for a crowd and to eat standing up 4) get water or eat near the water 5) He will serve food till he runs out, sometimes around 9pm so come earlySide note: Room 389 is a bar, it's set up as a bar not a restaurant so again be prepared to stand and deal with a crowded bar crowd when it gets later into the evening. The cool thing about Room 389 is that it's full of locals, a full range of ages for a bar from 20's - 40's, drinks are decent & people are friendly.
Awesome Trivia nights on Wednesdays! I can bring my dog! People love it.. awesome crowd..Sometimes the Trivia announcer is hard to hear due to the noise!

I just moved to Oakland from Atlanta (drove the distance), and have to say I finally found a place among the dozens of decent to good cafes around here that serves the best cafe mocha.Very cool building, low lit, tall wooden- bar tables in front of bar, with couches in the back, and a very short patio area. The pieces and pages of books comprise the majority of the wall, and are intriguing.Only reason it's 4 stars is that they only have one barista work in the morning so if there's a few people ahead of you, you may be waiting a bit. But with that said she's very polite, efficient, and takes multiple orders at a time, to try and speed it up- and again she made the best coffee drink I've had in years.

One of my favorite bars in Oakland. This place is a great neighborhood bar with a friendly staff that do their jobs well and a good selection of food. If you need a drink in Oakland, I recommend this place.

Cool little pub on Grand. They have a small patio area at the front door for chilling and smoking. This place was hopping on a Monday late afternoon. Nice variety of clientele made it fun and interesting. Everyone was really nice. Good and efficient bartenders were on board this nite. I would come back...

When you're in the mood for a super-crowded bar, definitely go to Room 389. Usually standing room only when the weather is nice. (when it's cold and rainy outside, it's much more quiet) Cocktails are fine, decent selection of booze. Quiz night is fun, but you can barely hear the questions sometimes. Prices are normal
this is a good spot for some drinks and some jams.  it's fun to post up in the back, where there's comfier lounge seating.

This bar is always my go-to. It's a great place to grab coffee and a quiche in the morning while cranking out some work on the computer, and a fabulous place to hang out for happy hour. Wednesday trivia nights are always great & A's games get the place packed. The bartenders are never phased, always friendly & great service. You can also have ethiopian, pizza, thai, and a handful of other places nearby that deliver to you in the bar so the fact that they don't serve much food is a non-issue.

Best coffee in the neighborhood, precisely what Adams point needed.  What I really appreciate is that they invest in good product (bicycle coffee) but drop the snobby attitude that usually goes along with a good single-cup drip coffee.I recommend the pour-over, but the french press is good too.  If you want your mind to beat itself into a bloody pulp, you can try the iced coffee but believe the barristas when they say it has tons of caffeine, I almost had a panic attack.  Your mileage may vary.Good pastries, friendly barristas, especially that Emily character.  Overall a nice mixture of swanky product and a fun neighborhood-coffee-shop attitude.

a really cool spot to hang and get drinks.the place is so 'lax and chill that when your gal asks that (dreaded) question - "soooo, what did you do last night?", you can proudly stomp the floor and say - "I had a few drinks with Jenna at Room 389"...yeah, (bad move) good luck with that.
Dude. FLASH. you da man....actually, you are a hero :) thanks for lookin out man! looking forward to stopping by soon!

Since moving to Oakland, we've come Room 389 a lot.  The beer selection is pretty good, HH goes until 8pm, and we like trivia night on Wednesdays.  It's a pretty good bar with terrible staff.  Staff is often rude.  One day we waited for 10 minutes while the bartender (who, yes, had made eye contact with us) served everyone else around us.  Another day a bartender rudely corrected my pronunciation of a beer name (who cares how I said it...I'm paying for it, right?), took my order, but then made a bunch of cocktails before giving me my beer.  The bouncer once got upset with me because I had to fish through my purse to get my ID. I could go on, but I think that's enough.I'll keep going because I like the prices and the vibe...but someone should know how I feel about the staff, right?

Is this bad??  3 bar reviews for one night?  Came here Saturday with my cousins.  I mean what can I say.  Been here plenty of times!  The only thing that has changes is the name and the owners.  But still has that same chill vibe.  Music was great, People watched/talked.  It was nice.Will return if I'm on this side of the Town.  I'm not into traveling for a good time unless I'm hoping on a flight.
Great new young crowd. Wish they had the Golden Bear Shots! from the rugby days!New owner doing a fantastic job!

What a fun place on a wednesday night! Highly recommend to meet some l-oak-ls!We went for trivia night and the busy bartenders didn't even flinch when they got super slammed. They just kept cranking out the great drinks with a smile and a little wink the whole time. Great service and the patrons are super friendly-guaranteed to meet some friends. They have a nice front patio if you want to breathe in some fresh (or not so fresh if smokers are around) air and you can take your drinks out there as well. In the back of the bar is a nice lounge area so you can intimately talk and chill if that is what the night desires. Either way you are sure to be pleased!Also they allow you to bring in food from other restaurants- but, be wary of the restaurant right next door. Food is not so good.

I work from home, so I really enjoy trying out all the wifi cafes in my area. This is without a doubt my absolute favorite place so far. I've only really been here during the day when they're more of a cafe, not a bar, but I can only imagine it'd be just as awesome at night.There's a ton of space, including a cozy lounge area in the back. The ambiance is really nice, and the best part (for me) is that they allow dogs. Holy crap. And they have empanadas. You can't get any better than that.

Mmmmm the greyhounds..made with grapefruit juice squeezed fresh to order and a nice healthy pour!  They also have an excellent beer selection.  A variety of seating areas, outside, inside on the couches, at the tables or belly up to the bar. A nice chill Oakland crowd and excellent bartenders.  Cool place to watch the game or meet up with friends. It's also a nice place to come sit outside and drink coffee in the morning.  did i mention how great the bartenders are?

I love this place. I love the bartenders (Mike and Hasani in particular), I love the drinks (their greyhounds and bulldogs are the best in town. Don't let anyone tell you otherwise. Believe me, I've tried them all). I also love the patrons (like the resident drunkards with hearts of gold) and I don't mind when it's as packed as a can of sardines during sports games because the energy is electric.

daytime unassuming in this room, as giving as the fluffy masa about this well cooked tamale and smoky as the bacon seeping in that bloody mary  languishing fronds of botany and circumlocuting ceiling fans, this room smacks more delightfully of havana than that dirty dancing remake ever could

Great open space.  I met a friend there to watch the warriors game (they lost, boo) and it was packed.  It was 4 or 5 deep when I got there but I didn't have to wait for a drink because my friend was belly up!  Decent beer selection on tap, although it ws no Toronado, but they have a full bar as well as some good southern food in buffet pans served to you by a nice man behind the counter.  They had fried chicken, mac n cheese, sausage in a bun, jerk chicken and I think some other items.  People were definitely going to work on the food.  Once the game was over I could hear the DJ playing reggae music and some Motown too.  Good crown, good mix of men and women, cool interior and lighting, a lot of seating and seating areas.Going to put this in my rotation for sure!

I've been here for coffee on a quiet morning after a lovely run around Lake Merrit, and I've been here for a jam-packed trivia night. Turns out that the small cafes and bars I keep finding around Oakland pull the same phrase from me: "Great neighborhood spot!" The same is true for 389. It somehow manages to feel like both a cozy cafe and a spacious bar. I'm a big fan of the outdoor patio, indoor couches, filament-bulb lighting, exposed wood, and house plants.The crowd is refreshing and always interesting, as it doesn't cater to a specific "type" - this is not JUST a hipster bar or place for nerds or destination for jocks. It genuinely seems to be the place where everyone gathers because it has something that appeals to everyone. It's an impressive quality in a bar/cafe. Perhaps it's because they started serving sliders on Wednesday nights during trivia...? But I don't think that would quite explain it. The coffee is solid, so are the cocktails, and so is the company. The one drawback (for me) is that people smoke on the patio, and since the doors/windows are always open, the bar gets smoky. Which means that my clothes and hair get smoky. Which means I have to go home and take my second shower of the day. Grrrrrr.

The gold standard for a pleasant bar experience. A diverse and grounded crowd, friendly staff, reasonable prices, original decor, and good music. Patio area has a nice garden of plants. Great addition to a neighborhood full of culture.

I've stopped in here twice with some of my favourite people. The first time it was a brief stop for JZ's birthday. The second time it was for Wednesday night trivia. JZ packed a corner for about three team's worth of Yelpers. Talk about awesome.I was surprised that our small team brought our A-Game, we all have different specialties which worked in our favour. The questions were diverse and varied. The drinks are priced within reason. At least I think they are...This bar is a lot bigger inside than I remember it being.We were able to bring outside food from House of Curries. It's also in a nice area on Grand. Will I be back? For sure. Trivia is tons of fun anyway...so yes, say the magic words and I'll be there.

The first time I came to this joint was in honour of the TL, who then moved far far away.  I was entirely too sober, made out with a hot chick, and then made sure my drunk friends made it home safely.  Not too bad for a first try, eh?  You're not reading anything past the 31st word, are you?  Perv.I had tried returning a couple times with more friends in the years that ensued, but things always came up, like other bars I liked a little bit more.  But the tides changed last week when JZ broke his UYE cherry and brought a shitton of people out on a school night to play trivia.  So much fun!I've been to a couple different trivia nights in my time, but this one was by far the most fun and engaging.  I'm usually the dumb twit sitting in the corner nursing my drink, but I helped rock the music edition of the quiz.  I even gave my own loud rendition of Whitesnake at one point (friends, forgive me).  The trivia master has an amazing soundtrack, reaching across a gazillion genres.As for the drinks, I'm a simple girl - no fancy schmancy cocktails for this one - but I've heard that they're really good.  The bartenders are great, though remember to be nice cus they're working really hard behind that wooden barrier trying to hydrate the masses pouring in and out of the door on a Wednesday night.  If you're into trivia night, come early to grab a seat in the back before they're all gone.  Trust me, they go fast.  I'll see ya there!

Trivia Night!Thanks John Z. for the UYE. It was a blast! Especially when Team Sandbaggers handed a humiliating 1 point defeat to our arch-nemesis Team Bloodborne Pathogens. That's right, in ya face!!!    :PThis was my 1st time to Room 389 & it was great. Trivia night was a lot of fun + it was $4 pints of Lagunitas IPA all night. It gets seriously packed even before 7:00pm & the bar was slammed, but the bartenders did a good job keeping up.Room 389. I liked it. Trivia night. Awesome. Hey, let's do it again!

Trivia night rules!This was a great time, thanks, John Z!The bar moves pretty fast, the tenders are great and have remarkable memories when you rattle off a long list of drinks.  Friendly, affable, and quick with a smile despite the rushed nature of their work - I love friendly bartenders.Food is available, though not abundantly, and they welcome patrons who bring food from outside (the curry place next door is great).If you've ever wondered... "Hmmm... Just how dumb am I?" ... then you absolutely MUST go to Trivia night and find out.  Few things are as rewarding as discovering the remarkable and unexpected depths of one's own intellectual inadequacy.I am officially dumber than a bar stool.

I really like this bar. Its so versatile that I feel totally comfortable bringing both my wild and more mellow friends here. Its airy and light during the day with high ceilings and a little outdoor seating area in front. I'm a fan of the high tables against the left wall waking in. They're comfortable and somehow make me feel socially at ease. So the lack of the fifth star comes from my disappointment to find that they don't offer a vegan bloody mary... There is a bacon garnish option (unusual yet offered) but no vegan option (unusual and not offered) for those of us who embrace a cruelty free lifestyle. I wouldn't even bother complaining about it except that I drank a million of them before learning they weren't vegan (my own stupid fault because I guess the typical bloody mary has worcester sauce which has fish oil or some fish product) because they're delicious! I want very much to go here all the time and drink bloody mary's with my friends but, until there's a vegan one, I can't...To their credit, however, they do offer soymilk in the cafe!I also had Cameroonian food there which I guess they have on the regular. This was before I was vegan so I'm not sure of the vegan status on that... But it was also delicious!So, to recap, really nice vibe/ambiance/atmosphere, really good drinks, nice cafe with vegan options and local Bicycle Coffee, but very much hoping they'll expand on their vegan options, particularly in the bloody mary category :-)One more thing! This bar has a really diverse clientele! I love that!
Yes, I am so digging this place.  Why the music.  I keep dropping in hearing this old soul disco sound and it's great.  The bar is excellent.  The crowd young, and the scene pretty chill.

Good bar, one of my favorites.  Always a good crowd.It's too bad one of their bartenders - big white guy with a beard - is a total d*ck.  Several run-in's at his end of the bar - he always seems to have an issue -  but I don't let that get to me, so now I steer clear and go with one of the others who somehow manage to remain super awesome even though it gets busy.

Uh oh Cafe Van Kleef, you have competition!! Delicious fresh squeezed grapefruit juice to form delicious greyhounds... Present!!! sliders sizzles in the front of the bar but the butter smell permeates all over leaving everyone smelling like buttery goodness..The place is always jam packed with friendly patrons trying to get a drink without causing a raucous. My kinda place.
Went here on a date- the drinks were good and unique. Did not have any of the food. Liked the vibe, and seating was alright, but the music was way too loud for my taste. Had to yell to talk.

this place should just stay being a bar. there is no table that's appropriate for any kind of work at this place - all too high. although, i can imagine chillin' in the front w/ some friends having a conversation or reading in the back lounge on a cloudy day. solid french press (which was premade). and like what others have said, service is pretty slow, since they only have one barista taking orders and making drinks.... he could only process one order at a time.

Decent drinks and plenty of room for pretty cheap. The cocktails were only like 8 dollars and the beers were 5-6. The PBR plus shot deal for 6 dollars is actually really decent. I want to try the food next time and happy hour.
I like this bar! Good mixed crowd with friendly staff. Still need to check out trivia night.

I'm planning on setting up camp in Room 389.Somehow I live 10 minutes away from this place, and unknowingly have been missing the best food on Tuesday nights.A 20s and 30s hang, this room is so inviting! I came here not knowing about amazing the Cameroon food I was missing in my life, and had my mind blown.Taste of Africa caters, and for $12 you get a (HUGE) plate that will satisfy your buds and belly.  Drinks are cheap from 4-8 EVERY day during happy hour, and there are smooth tunes by a DJ spinning.Great time. WILL definitely be back for  more!!

cool little bar in the neighborhood.  stumbled upon it while waiting for some friends.good drinks, had a perfectly made manhattan and some type of ginger beer whiskey beverage. both great!they started to have a dj blast some musics. plenty of seating. mixed crowd. chill vibe. 2 thumbs up!
Awesome cozy spot.  Very friendly staff.  Great place just to chill and have a brew.

I've been here twice so far and I've had good experiences both times :) The drinks are pretty darn strong so I'm glad to see that I'm getting my money's worth! The drinks off their menu are interesting but not sure if I want to spend $10+ on them again. I like my simply-made drinks just fine. The decor is very interesting and kinda hipster. They have ripped books on one side of the wall and some saloon type of decor going on near the bar. They have comfy looking couches by the back side of the bar and there seemed to be plenty of seating when I went both times. They were also serving mac n cheese one night (not sure if this is a regular thing) and it was delicious! Pretty decent serving for $7.If you go late enough at night, parking is never really an issue.This is definitely my go-to bar in Oakland!

Introduced to this hidden treasure when I went to a cookie exchange hosted here. Recommended the place as a lunch spot for my girlfriends and I to reconnect. Total fan.The breakdown:- atmosphere: chill. You can come here to get work done on your laptop or as a relaxed get together with friends- staff: suuuuuper friendly, easy going. The guy behind the counter when I went this last time whipped me up a hot buttered rum, off the menu item that was so freakin delicious. I wouldn't have even known had he not been so friendly and eager to make my experience there greatFood: delish. I got a tamale and an empanada. Nomx3I think its really cool that you pay using the iPad app- tip, signature and electronic receipt.I will absolutely return, with friends or to have some "me" time.Also: dog friendly4 stars only because I wish the menu was more extensive.

This place is amazing!!! First and foremost, they have bacon bloodymarys for that morning after pick me up. This is also a good place to watch Sunday football. The clientele is diverse and friendly and the bartenders are fantastic and very accommodating!

I went on a Saturday night and it was super crowded and loud. Other than that the decor is nice and the people are cool. Please note: I only gave 3 stars because of my first comment. I personally like a places where I can sit and talk.

I went to this place a few nights back for a friend's birthday.  I had heard of the place for months, but never made it in, so I was pleased to find a warm room, a friendly crowd and some tasty drinks.  The only bummer was my beer came in an SF Giants glass.  This bar is in Oakland.  I'm looking for Green and Gold on my glass.  It would have been 5 stars if the A's were on the glass.

Good music, good drinks, good bartenders, good interior, good seating, good vibes, good drinks, good people, good area, good retro, good service, good friendliness, good hospitality, good on a rainy day, good during a long wait from waiting for wedding reception to start, good alcohol. Great spot, very quaint & swanky.Bartender introduced himself to us, as well as asked for our names (sign of caring, or pretending to care, extra brownie points)He let us try this ginger beer punch concoction, very tasty. My party and I had time to kill while waiting for our friends wedding reception so we came here for some midday drinks, was well worth it.

Well, I'm not exactly sure you're *supposed* to dance here, but I did. This was my first time going here, which is long overdue, given that it's right in my 'hood. The vibe is typical bar in the front, cool lounge in the back. For sure I'm going back...hey, maybe before midnight this time! =)Parking isn't easy, but it's possible in this area.
5 stars for great coffee, nice patio, and full bar with fun cocktails and chill ambiance. I've never tried the sandwiches or pastries but they look creative, delicious and local.

Tasty bacon bloody mary (though I wish it came with a whole strip of bacon rather than just a piece) and great ambiance.  I was here on a Saturday afternoon, and it was almost empty, so I'm curious to see what it's like on an evening....

This is a pretty cool location, gets pretty packed on the weekend and the music was way too loud.  There wasn't really room to dance or anything so it seems a bit excessive for "mood" music.  People had to either half-yell or get RIGHT in your ear to be heard.  Go early or good luck finding a table or seat on the couch.  Other than that, the people were friendly and it attracts all walks of life.
Great place, drinks, vibe and food (on Tuesdays). Great prices too (especially during happy hour).

I love this bar and coffee shop right near the Lake.  I lived in Uptown Oakland  in 2006 before there were a lot of options in the area for hanging out and using public wifi and was really excited to find this treasure when I moved back to the East Bay this year.  Their coffee and espresso drinks are super tastey and their iced versions are downright addicting.  There is a full bar is you feel so inclined, the staff is friendly and they have fresh juice if you are looking for a different kind of pick me up.  There are tables where you can easily work or lounge areas in the back to relax.  Also an adorable little porch out front with an outside service window if you have your puppy or you do not want to come in out of the sun.

This was the 2nd stop on our Oakland adventure waiting for my little brother to get home so we could take him to dinner and boy I'm glad we stopped here! The atmosphere was great, people were friendly, & the drinks were strong! We watched the Giants game at the bar and had a great time doing it! I really really love this place!

Sampled: Bicycle coffee cappuccino & bran muffin. Time: 8:30ish AM Facts: 4 people in line & one barista. Thoughts: Coffee was tasty but took a long time to make & with the line, I would not suggest grabbing a quick cup before work. Barista was friendly but slow. Muffin was good but not exceptional by any means. May return in the future, but not itching to go back.

We were filming a shoot by the lake and wanted to have a drink afterwards. We happened past this bar on our way to a different bar, popped our heads in and winded up staying. The giants game was on and people were in a great mood, hot trays of fresh BBQ was getting set up for a dinner service and, unbelievably, people shoved up around a table in the back lounge to make space for our group of five.Maybe it was because the Giants were up 5 in the second inning, but the people in this bar were incredibly kind. I wanted a bitter beer, since I am always cautious about ordering cocktails in new bars. I chatted with a guy at the bar about beer while the bartender finished up with another customer. Then the bartender offered me a couple of tastes of beers on tap. I finally chose a Thelonious and wandered back past the crowd around the bar and into the back lounge area. A large group of women were celebrating a birthday in the lounge with us. They were all drinking cocktails and eating cake.Some of my group opted for the BBQ and two of us walked next door to pick up some Indian food from the House of Curries next door. The bar didn't bat an eye at us bringing in outside food. Between the food, the good beer, the friendly women sharing their table with us and the fact that the Giants were looking good to win the game, I got up the courage to order a couple of cocktails. My Rye Manhattan was pretty perfectly blended, dangerously well-blended, such that you forget how strong it is and drink it too quickly. My friend's Dirty Martini wasn't too wet and was good enough that she ordered a second.This is a really fantastic clean neighborhood bar. I can't wait to go back. Next time I will try one of their Greyhounds.
This bar has a wonderful atmosphere with a great sound system. I always have a great time here.

yes, yes, yes. I moved from Uptown to Adam's point and am happy because this joint is in walking distance!  Great neighborhood lounge that should be considered a gem of the city.  The people, music and decor are on point.  Tuesday nights are great here.  I've lived in Oakland long enough to recognize that certain bars get their "shine" for a moment before everyone finds the next new bar, but I don't think that will be the case for this place.  Stay consistent and don't change for the masses.  Who wants a drank?

Came here a few Tuesdays earlier this year for African night (I got a bit addicted to the food..I think it was a 3rd party that came in to serve food this place does not actually have a kitchen).  The front bar area is pretty big and the back is a lounge space with some very comfy couches and a cute DJ booth.  I like how there is always a place to sit and chill out with your friends when you are here.  The specialty drinks are well made and the crowd is a good mix.  I really enjoy hanging out here, everyone is super friendly.  If we have a group of friends I usually suggest this place.  It's a good chill bar to go to for a local (like me!).

This is probably the best cafe on Grand right now. Farley's isn't great - the coffee always tastes oddly acidic to me. Bellevue is okay, but the baristas can be a bit hostile and uninterested. At Room 389, the baristas are super friendly, and they serve the wonderful kouign-amann from Starter Bakery. Get that, and some cold processed coffee from Bicycle Coffee. It's an amazing combo. And try the quiche - it's great, even cold. In fact, it's almost better. Couple that with a sweet little patio covered in plants and Christmas lights, and a beautiful wood interior and you've got a great spot to hit in the morning on the way to work.

I like this place as a bar but as a cafe, it needs major help. I've come twice now for breakfast and the 2nd time was worse than the first with the indifferent service, my cold (tho "heated") quiche given to me in a bag even tho I said I was staying, and the bg music that comes on sporadically. When I reminded indifferent server I was staying he did grudgingly give me a coffee cup saucer to put my own quiche on it. And a fork was a total afterthought. If you want an empty bar to do some reading and have a bad breakfast experience, this is the place. Otherwise, come for drinks later.

I pass this place all the time while running and the two things I always notice are that one, it's always cracking and two, happy hour is EVERY day, yes inlcuding weekends!  So I was excited to meet up a gf for her bday celebration.  The bar ambience is super chill.  I like how they play their music from pandora =)  Drinks are classic and our bartender made a bomb old fashion and basil gimlet.  We ordered a shot for the bday girl and it was on the house!  To top that off, they had a moroccan food table set up in the corner.  12 bucks a plate of fricking yummy goodness!  Mind you this was all on a tuesday night!  Loved it and you already know I'm coming back for that morrocan food! =)

This is my fav neighborhood bar near the lake. Chill atmosphere that is nicely styled with plants and sections of books on the walls, indoor and outdoor seating. The drinks are cool and bartenders are cool too. I must say though, the vibe totally changed when they added a tv recently, not a nice addition. Still my fav spot but turn that thing off! It makes it seem more like an average bar, not special or unique. On Tuesday nights there's a soulful music DJ and a Taste of Africa sells food here which is hella good. Halloween was pretty crackn last year too. The lounge area was more like a dance floor and everyone was positive having a good time which is a common theme at Oakland's best parties. Some nights there is a taco truck parked out front too. Check it out.

Came here because I had a free coffee coupon thanks to Bicycle Coffee, and the lady behind the coffee counter seemed confused, said she only had French Press (which was fine, I just wanted a cup of coffee), then said that she had poured me 12 oz, but the card says it's good for 8oz only... as if she wanted to charge me for the extra 4 oz (I handed her the card from the start). I asked for a second one for my friend (who had his own free coffee card) and she said she could give me one only, as she had already given me more then the 8oz (although she did this of her own doing). We walked away mostly confused and decided this place is not worth visiting in the future. The 12oz cup we shared was tasty (Bicycle Coffee is always amazing), but lukewarm...
Big change from the Golden Bear!!!

Room 389 moonlights(daybreaks?) in the morn hours as a cafe. same flatscreens. same bar. cafe is at the front corner entrance serving coffee, sammies, pastries, empanadas. bloody marys, beer & wine served at the far end of the bar. lights are turned on brightly so people can read their papers/books.pour: west oakland coffee co, (lg, 2.5)-strong, smooth brew.drips:-plenty of seating on a sunday. parking not so plentiful.

This a cozy low key spot where you can just grab a drink and kick back. It's like a neighborhood bar with decent music depending on the day.This is not the spot you get dressed up to go to but the spot that you just want to go chill and unwind and catch up with a friend.

This is a cute neighborhood bar in a very nice area of Oakland. I love how there is a patio in the front, a nice bar scene once you walk in, and a lounge/couch set up in the back. The dress code here is very eclectic. Some are dressed up and others are wearing jeans. It's also a nice mixed crowd. The bartenders are awesome. Very social and are good at recommending drinks. The greyhound is a delicious drink. It's their specialty. I would definitely recommend ordering one while you are here. I was here last weekend and they had the olympics playing on the TVs. I would come back for a big sporting event. Give this place a try.

By far my favorite neighborhood bar.Classy, chill, tvs for watching the game, lots of cozy lounge seating and more than reasonably priced--especially during happy hour. It's the kind of bar where you could show up in your jeans and a tee shirt or a slinky cocktail dress and nobody would stare at you twice either way. The crowd is eclectic and diverse. The bartenders are SUPER friendly. My buddy and I were following our hockey team earlier this year and the bartenders graciously let us watch our games here with no complaints. Come for happy hour and order a freshly squeezed greyhound. Just don't blame me if the "if you give a moose a muffin.." factor sets in :)
Best neighborhood bar I've ever been to.  Good drinks, high quality beer, and reasonable prices.  Oh, and they're cool about you bringing in food to nosh on.

This review is based on two experiences at Room 389. Lazy Sunday afternoon and loud/fun Tuesday night African food. Both experiences were extremely enjoyable.If you're going there during the day on a Saturday or Sunday, I would highly recommend trying the bloody mary. It comes garnished with a crispy piece of bacon and delicious pickles. Perfect afternoon drink. They have a good beer selection. Really nice atmosphere during the day with sky lights. Now on a Tuesday night! African food = amazing. Atmosphere = loud, fun and filled with a hip crowd. We tried the fish plate and the chicken plate. Made the mistake of asking for two servings of the hot sauce (don't do that). They know what they're doing when they're only serving you one spoonful of it. Food is delicious and goes very well with the selection of beers on tap. I live in the neighborhood and will be going back for more soon.

This place is great, both during the day and at night. I've been for a few drinks at night and the atmosphere is very friendly and trendy, good music but you can still have a conversation. During the day, it's a great place for a cup of coffee while hanging out in the outdoor seating.

Ladies, rejoice!  A door man that actually keeps an eye on things at the door (and beyond), classy cocktails (watch out for the heavenly Basil Gimlet), well-dressed crowd that actually bathes and isn't knee-walking drunk (sorry, depressed hipsters)--perfection!  I go here and never leave less faithful in humanity.  Good music (more on the smooth, hip-hop tip), friendly people (a birthday party gave me + pals cake the last time we were there...it was my birthday, too!), cute bartenders (can take a bit on busy nights), and a nice patio out front for conversation-seekers.  Lovely couch area in the back for larger parties and looooong happy hours (4-8 PM!).  Check it out and make sure to keep your Debbie Downer friends away from here--it's what makes it precious to me :)
Super cool vibe! Coffee house by day and bar by night. Happy hour from 4-8 daily. Check it out!

Nice neighborhood bar with a good crowd of people. Every time I've gone there seems to be a big game on TV so usually a ton of people erupt with screams every so often. Drinks are good and not too horribly priced here, definitely not the cheapest in the area but they have nicer quality ingredients. The one thing I always get a little blah about with this place is that I do seem to stand at the bar and wait for a drink a little longer than usual. Maybe I'm used to gay bars where drinks are poured and handed off to you like wildfire but it does seem to take a little longer than average to get your drink. Other than that the vibe is great and it's only a feet steps from my house so I will keep coming back.
Fantabulous bar: great deco, good vibes, people of all colors, groovy music by live DJ on vinyl, enough space and quiet to talk, and tasty cocktails. One of the best bars i've ever been too.

Besides being a huge fan of its "night life", I LOVE 389's Cafe - I'm happy now to find myself there morning, noon and night!The Coffee:My favorite Saturday morning Oakland tradition has been walking to the Grand Lake Farmer's Market and enjoying a beautiful cup of coffee from the Bicycle Coffee Company.
