If you haven't yet tried Bicycle Coffee, it is a masterful, delicious, boutique coffee that is TRULY one of the Bay Area's BEST coffees!  I am thrilled to have the opportunity to experience such a great coffee EVERYDAY at Room 389 Cafe.  The "Pour Over" option is among the strongest, most flavorful coffee pours you can find.  389 is using Bicycle Coffee for the coffee drinks, and (I believe?) espresso beans from Roast of Emeryville - both are EXCELLENT additions to an already great ambiance of 389's bar decor.The Afternoon: Enjoy the drinks on the small patio outside or inside, if you have your  Joe in house, consider the Cafe's "Adult" menu with such deliciousness as the "389 Special" - the complements of Jameson, Kahlua, etc. are always nice additions to see at a cafe by morning, bar by night...The Pastries:Delicious fresh spreads from Oakland's local Starter Bakery!Lunch:Yes!!!  They have a (very limited) menu from a flat grill, but try their grilled cheese!  It is excellent!The Service:Emily is awesome!!!!  She serves a great cup and conversation with a smile and an inviting presence to enjoy coffee at 389 everyday!The only drawback I see with 389's cafe is of relatively dark space, even during the day, making it challenging if you're interested in reading or doing other work in a well-lit cafe.Otherwise, I'll have a Bicycle Coffee Pour Over in the morning, and a Green Bulleit at night.

I love Room 389..I've been going quite a lot lately! They have free wireless and most of the time I go, I have my laptop with me and a nice Grandhound (ask bartender to add some cherries) by my side. Also the DJ's are great, variety of great music, nice mellow atmosphere. On Tuesdays they have some triva night--so if you don't like that kind of crowd, its not a good night to go. I think its Wed. where there is a guy who comes in and sells plates of hot and tasty African food...YUM. Diverse crowd..nice seating. The only thing negative that I have to say is that twice there have been people with their dogs in there...not cool..in my opinion. I don't hate dogs, in fact I like them. However, when there are people consuming drinks and food, I'm not a fan.  Also, you usually have a tough time looking for parking...But I'm still giving it a 4!

Went here for St. Patty's day. Watched march madness while listening to old mo-town hits and drank tons of guiness (they even made 4-leaf clovers out of the foam).Great lounge-type spot. Pub Quiz on Wednesday

I was happy to see that there was a bar not too far from my place. I came upon it one day while taking the long way home. So I finally came here for the first time a few weeks ago. I got the basil gimlet and it was SO freaking good. The place was pretty busy (it was a Saturday) and I stayed towards the front. My only problem with this place was that being towards the entrance, all the smoke from the smokers outside, was coming in. It kind of ruined it for me and only stayed for a drink. Next time I come, I'll make sure to stay away from the entrance.

Great place down the street from the house. Within walking distance from downtown. Great drinks (according to my wife) and they even carry a great ginger brew for the non alcoholic drinker (sad face). They draw a cool crowd of people, and the music is great. I have yet to be here for the food they serve on the weekdays. I'd suggest this place to anyone.

A nice welcomed addition to the Lake Merritt area. Delicious drinks (Moscow Mules were amazing, so were the house specialties) and reasonably priced. Most definitely a mixed crowd; a little of this and a little of that, but made for good conversation. It got a little chaotic ordering at the bar, but the atmosphere and location are worth it. Definitely give it a try.

Yes! The Basil Gimlets are perfection (not cheep) but the happy hour makes up for pricy fancy cocktails. Food on Tuesday is good and Trivia on Wednesday is fun. Good Oakland crowd all the time. I wish you could rely on food trucks being there late night all the time. Guess I should yelp the food trucks.

Came here last night after a Rihanna theme-based birthday party.  The premise to look as closely to Rihanna (aka hoochie), without being overtly obvious about your hoochieness.  I was kinda happy that I didn't dress inappropriate considering that we ended coming to a bar afterward.  Not exactly the kind of attention I want.  I love hanging with my work folks--such a great group of people, always full of energy and spunk, happy about life, we love talking about teaching, and just catching up.  I had a couple of beers-- honestly, I don't remember that last time I got drunk.  Sure, I'll have a glass of wine here and there, but full on shots/hard alcohol, gosh, it's been months.  Trying to cleanse my aura and be really healthy.  Honestly, it's because when I drink a lot...I tend to have "beer goggles," and everyone appears so much more attractive than in real life.  And engaging in conversations while drinking, well, everyone comes off like George Clooney.  Charming as all heck, but when those lights come on, and I'm sober, I quickly notice the real deal.  I don't know, I think I'm just over the bar thing...like yeah, you meet people, if you want a quick hookup it's hella easy and there-- all you have to do is spot out the cutest guy and give a "come hither look," and boom, easy as pie.  But it's totally meaningless and you know exactly what you're doing.  I guess I've always been one of those girls that doesn't need a bunch of guys to pay attention to me. The way I see it, if you like me, cool, if you don't, cool.  Whatever floats your boat. Room 389 is chill, kinda divey with laid back couches, music was throw-back hip hop, the peeps were diverse.  I remember getting up to dance for a bit, then I looked at my watch, and realized that it was time for bed.  I do remember a guy asking me if I could teach him how to dougie.  So, I did.  I'm sure it made his night-- happy to do it.

Now this is a great place for diversity, food, music and Happy Hour specials. Come as you are and  bring a smile. This  local spot is truly an Oakland gem and you will be sure to love the African food prepared on Tuesdays! Need to get out try this place...

Cozy neighborhood spot with live DJs almost every night... who occasionally still spin vinyl. They have great specialty cocktails (with fresh fruits and juices) and fabulous service. I even have my favorite bartender there. The place can get crowded on the weekend, but still stays friendly. I love that they let me come in with my tacos purchased right outside the door!

I was surprised by the area, nicer than I might have thought and seemed better than the up and coming Fox Theater area on this particular day which appeared to be garbage day.  I initially stopped by for a bathroom break but of course had to have a drink to check it out.  Our GPS thought it was Golden Bear so it was a surprise when we realized it was something else.  I didn't see a sign out front so it was a bit hidden at first especially since we were looking for the wrong name.  Loved the long bar, the freshly squeezed juices for drinks and the coffee bar till 3pm was a definite plus.  I would imagine that an espresso late night would be great but I don't know if it is open later on a Friday or Saturday  night.  If in the area I would return.

We just missed the happy hour on this (which lasts till 8pm!  good deal) but drinks aren't expensive anyways.Chill bar with some nice couches to lounge around on in the back and a standard bar top near the front.  Really like the ambiance and chill feel of the whole place.  Later in the night they have a DJ come in.  Music isn't too loud so you can defiantly chat it up here.Yay!

Dig the back seating area, with comfy couches and twinkle lights. A bit too loud for my taste, would be better with some attention to acoustics. Yummy food and happy hour until 8pm! People seemed to be enjoying themselves, but I was overwhelmed by the building sounds.

This place is awesome :o)  Super friendly staff, the owner is awesome and it attracts a very cool and diverse crowd.  I recently started working at Glow Salon and Spa right next door and will sometimes grab a beer after I get off work and just chat it up with people in the bar.  REALLY though, I started going here because of the AMAZING COFFEE they serve in the am!  The Batista is very knowledgeable on how to make good coffee and espresso drinks (having worked for blue bottle my coffee bar is high, not to sound like a snob or anything, but it's hard to find someone that can do this the right way).  He knows a great deal about tea and healthy cooking as well.  Give it a go, you know you want to.

This is hands down my favorite bar in Oakland.  Great ambience, really cool staff and patrons, excellent drinks (love their greyhounds) and a good mix of music is always playing.  I really like the patio out front too.  What more can I say, this is the coolest spot in the east bay!
This neighborhood bar is friendly, warm, lively and fun.  It is a great place to meet up with friends, and the location is perfect.

Room 389 is a very pleasant drinking hole.  Walls with books tacked all over, plenty of natural lighting, enough seats for all the drinkers including comfy lounge couches, and on sundays bacon sizzling for your Bloody Marys.  Definitely a chill spot with a very mixed crowd.  Depending on what time of day it is there might be a DJ spinning some music, or just some fly cuts knockin on the speakers.  Drinks where stiff like I like'em, and service was good enough to go back.  Room 389 has a lot of potential, and for some reason kind of lacks life like this review.  Something just doesn't scream come have a drink here all the time, just maybe sometimes.

Went here on a Tues for DJ Cecil playing an all vinyl set for the night. They had an African pop-up chef serving some rally good ethnic food for $9 a plate. The music was dope and varied from soulful house, funk, soul and R&B. Ended up seeing some friends as well as making new ones. The bartenders are hella cool and arent the type of overlook people. They work the full bar from left to right to ensure that everyone gets treated equally. Stella for $5, made me holla all night. I like the layout from front to back. Plenty of places to sit in the front and middle and then the couches and tables are at the back. I'l definitely be back.
This place has a great ambience.  I really enjoyed trivia on Weds. night.  I'll definitely come back.

I have been here several times. It's a great bar, fantastic greyhounds, diverse and cool crowd. It's officially a regular spot to hit on my occasional Oakland night out. The outdoor seating is limited, but the hipster ambiance inside is where you want to be.

the guys are completely pervy and skeevy, and annoying. and like NOT in a good way.   they will not leave you alone, no matter how hard you try.   (think terminator with a gold chain)  :/but i mean, if pathetic is your thing then i guess this place is a gold mine.  just spritz on your favorite eau de desperation and have at it.  tried to go there and chill out with a girlfriend after work.  ya know, catch up, have a conversation, couple of drinks.  and these mungers just kept interrupting.  wtf!?!and speaking of drinks, they are always watered down and packed full of sugar.  I HATE THAT. because i want to actually taste my drink, not stroke out into a diabetic comma.  have gone there multiple times (hehe) and never gotten a good drink from ANY  of the bar tenders, and i've tried all of them.  (btw the female bartender with the blonde hair is the worst of all) to be honest tho, the owner does actually know how to pour.  so stick with him.  so if you are pretty, have tits, or want to have a conversation with someone.  GO SOMEWHERE ELSE.  ...but the burrito truck is awesome.
This place is perfect.  Diverse unpretentious crowd, lounge-y music, chill bartenders, and African food on Tuesdays and Wednesdays.Best Salty Dog ever.

I came in last  Saturday and was so pleasantly surprised by the service and the super friendly bartender (shocking, I know). I was met with unusual warmth: "How are you doing?" instead of "What can I get you?" I actually felt like he cared...how sweet! Even while doing 4 things at once, this friendly bartender somehow also found time to discuss the finer points of bourbon, and helped me select the North American. The cocktail was great, overall a very pleasant bar experience. I forget the bartenders name, but he looked a little like Luke Skywalker.
Slightly obsessed with this place. Went in here on a Monday night and they had a small band playing old-timey French music. Drinks are lovely too, so are the bartenders, hollaaaaa
Sultry, chill hide-away spot on the lake. Service is great and the dj still spins vinyl. What more could you ask for!!

I love this place. I may be biased because it's around the corner from my apartment (read: no cabs or drunk driving!) but this place is actually really awesome. Great cocktails, decent prices, and lots of seating.  Word has definitely spread over the last year though, because this place can get crowded!  No matter how crowded though, it's still an awesome spot. Great DJing, cool decor too, plus a taco truck in front :)

The former establishment, "Dapper", received the "Serenader" treatment a little over a year ago. And although i couldn't dig up the exact reason for the closing, I'm sure the neighbors are thrilled about it, still, you can't knock a business for the type of people they attract, since we all march to the beat of a different drum. The staff here is always pleasant, especially the bartenders during the day who will take time to describe beer, and answer questions about any drink you may be considering. Room 389 is a cool place to grab a mid-day beer along with some of the locals, some of whom used to frequent the previous establishment. At night, however, it turns into a melting pot of semi-awkward people, the occasional bikers, and some dude-bros sprinkled in for good measure.If that's your thing, then you will love this place after 10:00pm, otherwise, approach with an open-mind and a patient disposition. Oakland is extremely diverse in 2012, and so are the local hangouts.

This is my neighborhood joint. It's classy and laid back with attentive bartenders and really good specialty cocktails. PLUS they have trivia on Wednesday nights and who doesn't like a little bit-o competition with your fellow drink mates? If you like sports you can also visit this fine establishment to watch football and basketball comfortably. All in all a great alternative from the same-ole spots in downtown Oakland. Gotta support the Lake Merritt businesses in all their glory.

This is such a great little place. I came here for a birthday party for Gail N. and man was it good. The little taco truck in front was nice. The parking wasn't too bad. We found a spot a block away next to the lake and the drinks were good. The white sangria was my favorite. If I go back, that is the drink that will get me going all night. There is plenty of seating. We occupied the left side of the coach area with about 20 or so of us and there were people on the other side and so many tables next to the bar. Also, the people are so nice. We had some stranger sing my friend happy birthday and I had such a great time. GET THE WHITE SANGRIA!

Yet again another beloved bar in  Oakland.I'm kind of glad Oakland is such a tight knit community and that the rest of the world is afraid of it because that means more fun for me. Last  night was triivia night and I attended. Trivia isn't for everyone but it is definitely for me. The crowd is grown, intellectual, classy and fun.  There was not a surplus of hipsters at a bar that I like (for once) and they serve  The Brother Thelonious on tap. Score.Plenty of seating for groups, a comfortable smoking section and a clean bathroom. The whole bar reminds me of a book I'd like to read. The bartender was great. I ordered 2 complicated rounds for 5 people and he made no mistakes. I mean, it's his job and everything but I just appreciate that he remembered our drinks on the 2nd round , no problemo. Everyone at the bar was notably chatty and unafraid to say hello. I feel like that says alot about a place.  Note: standard drink prices and two flat screens playing college basketball.Who knew a group of middle school teachers would find a bar that fits their lifestyle verbatum and I'd end up as a contender in the games?   TEAM BBC4LYFE.So.Much.Fun.

Just checked out Room 389 for the first time last night, after we walked all the way from 355 which was just way too crowded.  The first thing I noticed was the nice little patio set-up, and what appeared to be friendly people chatting about interesting things.  The bar itself was warm and inviting.  I strolled up to see if they served absinthe and indeed they did!  A friendly bartender named Emmy even gave me the lowdown on the different types they serve there.  The vibe of the whole place was just right, as others have stated.  I do believe I'll be coming back for more drinks!

Any bar lives or dies based on the atmosphere they provide. That being said, Room 389 definitely lives up to a nice atmosphere with friends and the likes for a round of drinks.Their selection is fairly wide in spectrum, but I've had some hesitation ordering mixed drinks from them as one day it'll be way too much on the liquor, and another day where it can be fairly weak.Their lounge area in the back is very attractive, as it's part layout of their back "dance area" so to speak. The overall size of the bar is relatively small (long and deep, but narrow), but their patio area up front (ash trays provided, yay!) makes up for the room lacking.Their live music is hit or miss, as can be expected from differing DJ's on hand.Been here on a regular weekend, but also for holiday celebrations like New Years. There's no real "barrier" here, that is to say - you won't be filled with disdain from hipsters dressing up like their from the 1940's or anything. Or will you find yourself weirded out from any other clique. It's overall a very open atmosphere, very relaxed and friendly all about.I once read that this was a "dry hump" bar? ... I could definitely see that, but it won't be without reason i.e. dry humping to John Mayer or some stupid bullshit like that. It retains a level of class that anyone can tolerate.It won't be a waste of time to check it out if you're looking for a new bar to try out.

Wow, this bar blows me away!Live music on a Monday night? There was an accordion, violin and guitar trio playing later on in the night. When we walked in the bar they were playing jazz music. Gave the bar a nice grown up environment which my girl and I thoroughly enjoyed.Atmosphere is awesome, I love the old style electric lighting they use.Bartenders are friendly. The Bloody Mary they have here is pretty good, and I don't like Bloody Mary's or vodka in general! Nice and smokey.Will come again. Highly recommend!

First time here and I am not much of a bar-goer, but I felt very comfortable here. Mellow and plenty of sitting place at the bar or lounge area. Came on trivia night (Wed) with lots of participants. Nice feel to it. Other patrons were very friendly. They also serve food! They had garlic noodles, shrimp shrimp rolls and veggie spring rolls. Very yummy! I loved the shrimp rolls. Cocktails were good too. I would def come back.

Came here with a group of friends at 11pm on a Friday and it was pretty crowded in the lively way without being too packed.  We got to the bar and were able to order drinks pretty quickly and was able to find a seat.I love their greyhound, which is fresh squeeze grapefruit juice and vodka.  It's $9 but  have to pay an extra dollar for them to use kettle one- which is how I prefer it anyway.  The crowd is very diverse and the music is more of a hipster soulful feel to it.  It definitely feels very East Bay (if that means anything to anyone) compared to a bar in SF.   The vibe of the place is very nice in that you have a diverse diverse group of people who are pretty lively without being obnoxious and the ambiance is casual and chill but not dingey.  They also had a taco truck right outside of it at 12am, that's a nice bonus for those are get the munchies afterwards. The only reason why I docked it a point is that by 11:15, they ran out of grapefruits and had to use juice concentrate for their greyhounds.  One of my friend was unlucky to get that and everyone thought it was really gross.  It was way too sweet and just tasted really bad.  I understand if stuff runs out  but 11pm is pretty early to run out of stuff for one of your signature drinks.
Great place to grab a drink where you can still hear your friends speak. When the weather is nice, the outside area is pretty full, but the inside has plenty of comfortable seating.

I look the small, loungy type bars emerging in Oakland.  It seems like a pretty lively, and down-to-earth crowd that comes through.  On warmer days they have outdoor seating.I've always found their bartenders friendly and responsive.  Their bloody mary with bacon (yes! fresh bacon) is really good, you can taste the infusion of the bacon flavor.Wednesdays they have trivia night, I haven't played yet but my friend really wants to,Last time I was there there had this group local catering group "Simply Garlic" sell garlic noodles and spring rolls on the side of the bar for pretty cheap.  That food went really well with the drinks.

I do a simple rating scale for my food reviews (1 through 5, with 5 being extraordinary).Food: (Drinks) Not a drinker so no ratingService: 3Ambiance: 4Wait Time: No waitPrice: 4Overall: 4Additional Comments:  Really chill bar and lounge near Lake Merritt in Oakland. Apparently they have different DJ's each night with different beats. Was there on Friday and it was Reggae night. Before ya make yourself comfy in the back lounge, get your drinks first; was confused why there were no waiters/waitresses. Can see myself making this a local hangout.
Great atmosphere here in a local Oakland setting.  Lots of great beers and well drinkings.  The best part is just walking home after too many drinks! Yeah!

The location. The decor. The vibe. The music. The CLEAN! restrooms. I don't drink much & don't know how to rate them but if I did I'm sure it would be just as tasteful as all else. This is where I am preparing to plan a holiday event next month for my visual and performing artists group!
Nice location...the bartenders however, are not that friendly:( There are so many other new bars in Oakland that I probably won't come back here.

Been here a couple times. Every experience is a great one. Great place to get together with some friends. Mellow kind of setting with tvs playing sports channels. A lounge area with plenty of couches to hang out in the back,-Happy hour everyday from 4pm to 8pm EVERYDAY!-Diverse crowd of people.-Little patio area outside for smokers.-Chinese restaurants right next door that delivers.-Taco truck outside on some days.My friends and I had made this place "the hangout" spot whenever we feel like having a drink, just to relax and unwind some stress.

Great bar on this side of the lake. We came in here after our last outing to Sidebar.Diverse crowd was the best part - old, young, and every ethnic group represented. Don't get to see this as often as I'd like.The decor was mellow - I liked that they turned off the two TVs. The drinks weren't too bad. Bartender wasn't the friendliest girl around but oh well. Ain't no thing.Still looking forward to come back and spend a full night with friends here.

I was pleasantly surprised by this spot.  All my friends have already been but me, so I had to check it out for myself.  Went there on a late night and also during happy hour.Happy Hour was pretty mellow.  The bartender gave me enough attention as I sat there by myself before my friend showed up.  He wasn't annoying.  He made some weird concoction from the ingredient of the day (lychee juice)...it wasn't working, so he made me something with Cachaca on the house.  It was great...just a hint of sweetness with lots of citrus flavor and that drink was STRONG. Apparently, they make their drinks pretty stiff...I'm a lightweight, so one drink works for me! heheAnyways, at the back of the bar, there's a nice seating area...it's got a nice vibe, not creepy like some of the other Oakland joints I've frequent.  It's got a bit of a hipster feel...but a bit more mellow.  Not sure about their music rotation, but I know from time to time, they spin vinyls and got live bands. Bottom line: Yah, I'll be back for a drank or two!
Nice decor with a couple of televisions. I watched the greatest single night of regular season baseball here.Bicycle coffee and pastries are served in the mornings.

I can't say that much about the bar because I wasn't drinking, but the trivia guy was not so fab.  I couldn't hear what he was saying and he didn't seem to really know much about the questions.  I think the atmosphere here was cool, so I think I'll have to come another time when I'm not doing trivia.

This is what I'd call a Yelp bar. The type of bar where you wouldn't know it's awesomeness unless you knew a local or Yelped it!Saturday Night visit:Parking was easy.Drinks were Stiff and easy to get. No hovering around the bar for 15 minutes trying to get the bartenders attention. Got a great table within the first 5 minutes. Since it was big, 4 others came and shared the other side. No problem!Lounge seating in the back, but they had an engagement party there so seating was limited til the last hour before closing. They also had seating in the front outside which would be cool in warmer weather.Low light ambiance, great mix of music. Great crowd. Diverse and friendly. No one trying to show out or be a bad ass.Missed the happy hour but if I lived closer, I'd definitely be here!Overall, I love this place. Will definitely be back again.

My five star rating is based soley upon their Monday evening lineup, which is:  French cafe music.  I've got a fair bit of knowlege on this subject (listen to a variety of it on my digital collection and have been to Paris often) and have to say this is a great contribution to the Oakland Arts scene.  Celia (violinist), John (guitarist), along with the accordian player (Colin) and the bearded dude on the bass, are all pretty amazing.  The night I went, there was a wet dog which contributed to the ambrosia (ou, l'arome d'un cafe francaise).  If you enjoy live performance and embrace joi de vivre, this is the place to go Mondays 9.30 pm to midnight!

Cool joint right down the hill from my friends house. Happy hour in particular is awesome. Taco truck is cool, but the real deal is the Chinese place next door. Stick with appetizers, and if your nice (as I am after a beer) they will even deliver it.Someone said something about weak drinks, never been a problem. But I have heard of such things happening to bad tippers...just saying.

Venue is nice - a great place to bring a group.  There is an outside set of tables and chairs, a dive bar feel in the front inside, and a lounge area in the back near the dj.  Mixed drinks - don't do it.  Get a beer or something that doesn't require measuring.  It was $7 or so for a mixed drink and there was just a drop of liquor with tonic.  Get real right now.
Fun spot on a Friday night, lively, some singles on the prowl and great music.  Fresh juice cocktails!

Good neighborhood spot. Close to the house, good music, good drinks, diverse crowd and...the best part: theres a taco truck outside. Perfect. My one question, is it that oakland lacks attractive men or they all just go out in sf because there is a famine honey, a famine of beauty.

Really like this spot for an evening cocktail. Always meet friendly people. The specialty cocktails can be a little inconsistent...but overall pretty good.However, this place is NOT FRIENDLY TO SPORTS FANS - even though they show sports on the TV. My husband and I were chastised by the bartender because we were cheering "too loud" watching a college football game at 5:30 pm on a Saturday. We alerted the bartender of our intention to watch the game as soon as we arrived and were assured it was no problem. Everyone in the bar (less than 15 people) was friendly and open about us watching the game. Then 2 women showed up and sat at the bar and must have said something to the bartender about our level of enthusiasm. Next thing we know, the bartender - who we'd been getting along with really well up until then - got on our case about cheering. We cashed out our tab and left at half time. Not cool.We'll still go for cocktails, but don't put sports on the TVs if you don't want people to cheer! Super lame.

My latest and greatest local watering hole. Not an easy feat -- but it offers exactly what I look for in a solid libation peddling establishment:-Stiff drinks (greyhound is my drink of choice here -- can't beat a cup full of vodka with a splash of freshly pressed grapefruit -- looks like the competition is catching on, VanKleef!)-Happy hours until 8PM everyday-Ample seating -- always room to lounge in the couches in the back-Diverse crowds-Always good music (with an eclectic variety) -- DJs on most nights, I caught an amazing bossa nova band on a Monday night once...-Patio smoking area (understandably, you can't bring drinks out there after 10PM)-Taco truck hangs out in front

i thought i was going to grab a drink with a friend and wind down from the day. decided to go here cause it was nearby and supposedly had a nice vibe. if you have a bar (or any business) that's open during times when they're giving people parking tickets on your street, it would be nice to inform people as soon and as often as possible (right as they walk in the door, for example). thankfully, one of the security people informed me right as a meter maid was pulling up on my car. nice gesture, hella appreciated it. but then as i'm walking back in, same dude begins implying that i buy him a drink. "i saved you 60 bucks didn't i?" sure, but the etiquette in even asking that was out of pocket. (supposedly the bartender was gonna charge me for his drink but i was annoyed and left). in fact, if i was the one that told someone about their car being ticketed, i'd actually leave it at that and chalk it up as a nice deed for the day. really though, it put me in a really weird position as a customer, as someone who was spending money at this place to RELAX. but that wasn't the end of it.so one of the staff (at least he seemed like staff cause he was kickin it behind the bar from time to time) proceeds to give me a hard time about it. i'm like "yes, that was nice what the gentleman did, now get out my face please." but he continues to HARASS me to the point where my friend is like "yes, it was really nice, but we're done talking about it!" needless to say, my chill relaxing evening at the bar was ruined. point is, read the parking signs, expect to get played with by the security, and harassed by the staff. i'm sure this place is generally fine but i'm taking my business elsewhere.

Big fan of this spot. The somehow nailed the art of subtle. Most newer bars in the town that look this nice become way too pretentious and over-priced in a matter of 4 weeks. It's got great taste as far as decor and even posted up 2 TVs above the bar.(rare in Oakland) It's nice to be in a "lounge" and still check up on the A's. Patio out front is great except typical Grand ave fair of peddlers asking for 87 cents. Great beer selection. Order Chinese food next door or pizza from Lanesplitters and hang out all day

4/5 localitei've been here a few times now, after my friend bossladypatty recommended it. something about it being an old Cal alumni joint. anyways, i think it's a great spot. the music is chill, and the crowd seems that way too. don't have to worry about anyone spilling their drink on me, or that i won't have a seat if i'm looking for it. the drinks are also pretty solid (read: strong), and sometimes there's a taco truck outside!overall, quite pleased to have this as the local option.

This is my favorite bar.  Fantastic cocktails (I like the Red Rum #2 best).  Ambiance is perfect.  Music is always good, and a good volume to talk over, and listen to at the same time.  Go there on a Monday night, and you might get to see Trio Zincalo which is a kick ass Tango / Gypsy-Jazz etc ensemble.

Cool place with good music! I was however a little tipsy prior to arriving but I loved it. The bartendar was great I think his name was Henry or Harry; he was awesome. The crowd is down to earth and relaxed.
Great Happy Hour! I had a greyhound, it was very tasty. just $5, and the juice was fresh squeezed and so nice and pulpy!

This used to be a sports bar called the Golden Bear. They showed Cal games, had Cal gear and memorabilia on the walls and on Sundays it was all about the Silver and Black...Now it has turned into something more eclectic. Room 389 is a cool lounge focusing on music and artful cocktails. This is more of a fit for this Grand Avenue location down near the lake. Less about sports and more about the tunes. They turned the back area into a lounge where you can kick back and listen to the dj play some funky music. The bar area's swanky and fairly spacious. Their patio is out the front by the sidewalk.  Just be aware of those passerbys who need money to get back to Hayward or somethin.....

I absolutely love this place! It's by far one of the coolest neighborhood bar/lounges in the Lake Merritt-Oakland area! Super friendly staff, great drinks and good music. On any given day you may hear your local DJ spinning fine vinyl tunes, no serato here! The owner is not some douche bag just collect money, he is actually super cool and puts in his fair share (if not more) of hard work behind the bar. Sometimes there is  food being served (for a small fee). The vibe is one of a neighborhood hang out and most people do know your name lol. The bartenders are well educated about their selection of spirits and they recommend superb choices. The place is safe and people respect one another there. If you want good people, and a great place to meet some of the locals come to 389 in Lake Merritt California.

we stopped in here to meet up with a friend.  definitely a cool chill spot in oakland to grab a drink and kick back.  when i went it wasn't crowded at all - it was perfect and people were really friendly.  i loved the decor and the red mood lighting.

For a bar, this has a great atmosphere.Truly a mixed crowd; Oaktown at heart.The bartender was cool and served well -  "listened", was approachable and non-threatening - you know what I mean... how often you've walked up to a bartender and they seem bothered the moment you request something "different".     Clean bathrooms rates high on my list!Lounge area and outdoor seating!Bravo - well doneI'd like to try Monday or Wednesday when the DJ spins - next time...
Great place. Totally fun and diverse crowd.  Great build out.  Everyone knows your name.

The place was nice, Scotch menu, well-poured drinks and cool DJ.Unfortunately, there were more lesbians than cute single women the night that I went, but from the other reviews, I don't picture this as the norm (?)I like a nice spot to have a drink with a classy lady, not expensive, friendly, and it really helps that they have two perfect tv's at the bar.No dancing, but if you want a drink, it's a good option.EDITI've been back a couple of times since my first post.  This is a low testosterone area, snobby, and if you're heterosexual, you'll find it challenging.  I prefer more authentic Oakland spots, and i've found several that are less expensive and a lot more fun, where a man can feel more comfy.
For Oakland, this place is pretty snazzy pants. Cute decor and ambiance. Stiff drinks, eclectic crowd - diverse in race and age. Friendly bartenders. Go check it out!

I would give this place 3.5 stars because it was pretty casual and the crowd was amazing, very diverse and not too crowded. The bar area was really nice and modern, but as you walk into the lounge area the decor changed a little. I would remove the Christmas lights and add something more modern, it didn't tie in well with the bar area. Restroom was clean.Other than that great music, very mixed. As a note, there's no waiter/waitress. You would simply order at the bar, which was okay for me.

This review is for the Cuban Salsa on Saturday afternoons that is happening this summer.  I've gone twice now and it is really fun!  Music is great, people are friendly and the vibe is very warm and authentic.

This place has a great vibe.  The crowd is very laid back and eclectic, drinks are tasty, decor is warm and comfortable.  They pay attention to detail here, from the flickering votives scattered around the lounge area to the tropical plant apparently thriving at the dj booth.  I have been here twice...once on a date with my honey, and again to celebrate a birthday with a group of friends.  Both evenings were memorable and fun, service is great!The best part?  They have reggae nights with djs spinning real roots reggae!  The music was excellent both times we stopped in.  The dj knew his stuff, played some rare tracks, and even indulged my requests!

I lived in SF for the last 3 years trying to find a place like this and here it is waiting in Oakland for me the whole time.  This place has a very nice setup and very adequate bar service.  The DJs were playing great lounge music and bottles were the option when we strolled here on Saturday at midnight.  Also, there was no hassle in line or a cover.  The biggest attraction? The taco truck was right outside just waiting for you to get that super al pastor burrito.  Will def come here again!

It was a rainy day on my first time at 389, but none the less, the party wasn't stopping.  We walked in thinking just another bar, nope, that wasn't the case.   The DJ was on point with music with throwbacks on the list,  the crowd was of-age, bartenders served drinks with no delays.  It's a damn good first impression, and I listed it on my fav spots in the O.

What can I say about the bar that knows my beverage of choice before I even fix my lips to order it? What is there to say about a place that has the teams that I want to watch on two big-screens whenever I decide to stroll in for a quick sip and to decompress after a hectic work day? All I can say is that I f'ing love this place.Bartenders:Hasani is the man! A very engaging "liquid therapist" that has a great attitude, is super efficient and provides the best banter when my homies and I are discussing controversial issues...or just plain, good old fashioned s--t talking. Ben is the best too!!! I had my last birthday party here and I must say, he made it a memorable one.Drinks:There is an extensive menu filled with their signature cocktails, as well as a great selection of beer and wine.Food:On Fridays, either 510Burger or one of the best damn taco trucks in the world is parked outside. Some nights they have a sushi chef and on others, "A Taste of Africa".  You are also able to bring food in from one of the many great restaurants that the neighborhood has to offer.Service:Superb!Price:Hella right!Overall...just a great damn bar!

My friend X is to 389 what Norm was to Cheers, so I've been to this bar on most Friday's after work!  The staff is friendly, the crowd is diverse yet unpretentious and happy hour goes to 8 pm.  It's a great neighborhood bar with a good atmosphere.  As for food, you can bring in pizza, Chinese or Thai from the local neighborhood businesses or come on Friday's when the taco truck is there (yum)!I'm purposely holding out on that 5th star because my boyfriend seems to think that an evening spent at 389 qualifies as a date-night spot (NOT)!

Excellent boozes and sweet sweet tunes.  Plus I can catch some of the A's game during Happy Hour, which makes me very happy indeed.  I'd love to try the comfy-looking chairs, but I can never seem to get away from the bar!  They have a facebook page if you want to know in advance about specials and music selection.  Oh, and it's not too loud.  Nice.

I've been here twice now and both times i was left with the impression that they are still trying to figure it out.  Bad service, overpriced drinks and nothing to do.On the plus side, cool decor and a huge improvement over Golden Bear.  Good luck....

Very cool place with a DJ that plays records! Yes he has a turntable and 45s along with long play. Talk about retro. And the furniture in the back is uber comfy stuff. Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is that at 7pm in the middle of Happy Hour there was only one bartender who was definitely having trouble keeping up. Otherwise thumbs up to this find.

I just like going into a bar that isn't so ridiculously loud that you can't talk to the person next to you.  Maybe I'm old, but having to yell into someone's ear that is literally inches from you is fucking annoying.  If I wanted to get drunk and go deaf at the same time I would go see My Bloody Valentine without earplugs and a flask of Everclear in my back pocket.This place has a lot of great things going for it.  The decor is great, the drinks are generous, the bartenders are quick and the crowd is a great mix of Oakland late 20 and 30 somethings of every color in the rainbow.  If that wasn't good enough, they also DJ 70s dub and reggae and have food from A Taste of Africa, which I would eat even if I knew it would give me AIDS.  The last time I was there on a weekend there was a taco truck in front as well.  Game on, bitches.

Very close to my house which helps immensely but this place is great. The owner is cool and all the bartenders know their stuff (for the most part). I stick to Manhattan's (which are poured with a nice heavy hand) but the other cocktails look decent as well. There is also a weird guy who grills on the patio sometimes. His food is pretty good but another guy who does kabobs and other things is better. Also, during busy nights there is a taco truck outside. Boom.

This place rules. Happy hour is til 8, so I have time to commute back from SF to OAK. to get me drinks on!As of late though, i've been stumbling in after running the lake. Meh. Counterproductive much? They have burrito trucks, or some kind of food stand happening every time I've gone. Which is nice, if you're just getting off work and want a bite to eat. Also, you can bring in food. Ah-ha. Nice.The decor here is nice and funky.  There's nice comfy couches in the back. Although I try not to sit on the couch, from fear of falling asleep while being drunk. It's happened too many times... I love that this bar brings in the best of oakland, the crowd is usually laid back, and funny. And you meet all types of different people that are Oakland natives, what more could you ask for? Shout out to Ben for naming that one drink after my word. "S---E". Well it's not on the menu, and even if you knew what the word was no one would know what you were talking about, cept for Ben. Pst, quick tip TRY IT. Really really, good. Chill and attentive staff! Major, shout out to Hisani as well! Love this place. They'll still serve me even when I smell like sweat or wet dog.Oakland's hidden gem.

Looking for that perfect neighborhood stop for a relaxing moment before heading home?  This is the place.  The menu goes from fancy hangover cures to great draft beer choices.  The owner and staff were friendly. The food is amusing, as one night a week gives you a taco truck, guest chefs come in on other nights, and the dim sum joint next door will shop the clients,Cool without pretension.Diversity with harmony.You just got to love Oakland

I like 389, no doubt. Of course, I'm biased 1) being totally down with the Oakland vibe and 2) this place being within walking distance of my pad. The decor here is smart and the crowd is casual. They have a few sports TV's for a laid-back Sunday afternoon, and they have wifi when drinking isn't fulfilling enough. Be sure to strike up a conversation with one of the bar tenders if things are quiet enough. I found that they're pretty damned cool, and it just add so that welcoming-neighborhood-bar feeling.

After having dinner nearby for a friend's birthday, our group came to Room 389 to hang out for the rest of the night.The place is pretty spacious and for a Friday, it wasn't very crowded. All good...I don't like sticky places anyways. This particular night, it was filled with hipsters. It was good energy from good people just wanting to enjoy the night. If you want a seriously low-key place to chill with friends and still be able to hear your conversations, this would be a cool spot.

Bartenders are AWESOME! They poor NICE.I love when they have some outside vendors...especially love the BBQ (& he does it in the rain even!).  Get either the smoked tri-tip or ribs and you're set!  Love the Happy Hour wells with the good music selection!  Way better than the old bar.

My new favorite local bar, with my new favorite local bartender. Cooper makes a great sazerac and she is easy on the eyes. Good music, good atmosphere, good people (so far). I will be frequenting this place often.

Nice place!  Good drinks. Cool atmosphere. And, it helps that it's 2-3 blocks from my house!They now carry Redbridge (gluten-free b33r)! and also serve Ace Pear Cider.  Sounds kinda weird, but two great tastes that go well together)
389's blend of smooth DJ beats, sexy and sophisticated bartenders,  and seriously intoxicating cocktails makes the perfect blend to any night of the weeks drinking habits.

Love it. Our current go-to for an early mid-week beer, or late night weekend greyhound. Think Lucky Lounge - but clean, chic, and ready to juice a grapefruit at your request. The lounge style seating in the back is a great place to relax with your peeps -- and being that it's open seating, it affords the opp to mingle with strangers and make new friends. Which we did... and got free cupcakes out of it! Admit it, you're jealous.

Hubby and I stopped in after a long week just to check it out and we were impressed. We're not big drinkers (he doesn't drink at all) but the atmosphere was great. The bar tender (Ben I think) made a custom drink for me and was very friendly and knowledgeable. We live right up the street, I'm sure we'll pop in again soon. This will be a great spot in the summer when the weather is favorable.
a far cry from the former tenants...I'm now on a first name basis with the owner so yeah it's safe to say I'm a fan. So happy this spot re-opened as soon as I moved to the neighborhood!

Oh la la! I like this bar!The decor was Amaze-balls. As a librarian I love all the halfed books that are tacked to the wall. Me and my friends kinda wonders how they would hold up, but whatever, right now they look hella tight. The drinks were high quality and moderately priced which, which was key. I love me a bar with mixed clientele, a little bit of everybody was in there- which is awesome- considering it IS OAKLAND...The music got a little loud at times, which is kinda annoying for a place that didn't really have a space to dance... maybe the back is opened up from time to time ( I hope it is, cause dancing makes a place pop!) Definitely a solid spot for drink just a touch better than casual. I will be back!

I really can't say enough positive things about this place. The energy is great, the bartenders and staff are friendly, the whiskey is abundant and it's a great place to watch the NBA. The back area is extremely comfortable with ample couches to spread out. I'm also a fan of the DJs who spin records here, as they are capable of providing the mellow or the dancy, depending on the moods of the crowd.

i like this place. good music and plenty of couches!  it can get busy, but it has a good crowd rotation.i remember the place being a burger joint, and the bar meets that needs when I am in the area.  nothing to go out of your way for, but certainly a needed bar by the lake.
Great spot on a Friday night! It was alive inside but our group still got one of the couches in the back and it was so nice to have a place to sit and chat.  The drinks were good too!
Good beats, good cocktails/beer selection, good peeps.  All you need in a bar.

Several weeks ago, I was out running along Grand Avenue on a Saturday afternoon and, passing what is now Room 389, I noticed something was amiss.  The lineup of random dudes lurking outside of the Golden Bear, catcalling at unsuspecting ladies, was gone.  No one asked me if I wanted a thug in my life; no one called me "sweetie."  Where was the Golden Bear and all of the associated ridiculousness?Replaced by Room 389!Room 389 is a really nice, regular bar.  Decor is interesting but not swank; drink menu us modest but reasonable; music is fine but not over-the-top hip; people that work there are totally friendly and casual.  But it is revolutionary by virtue of its location.  By replacing a ridiculous establishment with a regular, friendly neighborhood bar, and adding some nice touches (the fresh citrus drinks), the owners effectively tapped into the mountain of demand emanating from Adams Point residents like myself who sometimes just want to go out for a beer but who don't need stadium seats or cat-callers.  Welcome to the neighborhood!

Great place to hang out with friends, they are dog friendly, food friendly, and the crowd ebbs and flows. I only go because one friend will only take me there cause its 2 blocks from his house LOL! i get to drive...regardless,  I do not even mind the Slacker Radio music...

Chill little bar in my 'hood, within drunken stumbling distance from my apartment~ hell yeah! I was afraid that I had been misguided by the reviews when I walked in for the first time and saw two bearded elders and no one else sitting at the bar. But! The bartender quickly made me and Angie W yum little drinks and after a few sips people magically started flowing in.The bartenders I've encountered here have always been very nice and fun to chat and laugh with. The crowds are mostly locals, very nice people to bum cigarettes from. And speaking of cigarettes, their little patio in the front is so cute! The music is a little off to me...but very unique ~ from jazz to hip hop to oldies rock. They don't serve food here, I don't think...but it's surrounded by an awesome selection of cultural eateries: sushi, Ethiopian, Korean, Thai, Chinese, etc.I really really love this place! This has got to be the best addition to my neighborhood!

I was chatting with a friend about the lack of places to go for a cocktail in the area or that the ones that are in the area, basically suck, with some exceptions.  He asked if I had been to A389.  I replied "is that the place on Grand with the small patio area out front?"  Yes!  "I went there over a year ago, not a very friendly crowd, charged me $10 for a well drink, I got the hint"  My friend stated,  its not the same place, new owner, check it out.I stopped in, great remodel,  warm, cozy, they have this vintage Pioneer receiver and speakers in the front portion that work and have such a great sound.  While I was there the DJ was playing some back ground, jazz, thump, tunes that was just right.  I chatted with one of the Bartenders briefly and told him it was my first time there,  he bought my next drink!  The back area is more "loungy"  with lots of comfy seating.  I really like this place!

Great bar.  Specialty cocktails and a great SF ambiance.  I always notice that when I go here I try to dress especially well and it seems other patrons do too.  Dark, but not too dark.  Apparently the dancing is pretty good despite the small size.

I dropped in here the first week they opened and didn't think much about it - figured it was brand new and nobody knew about it.  It was nearly empty on a weeknight so I was worried for its survival as a new business in my hood on Grand Ave.Alas, I dropped back in for a drink and to catch up with an old friend on a Thursday and when we first got there it was empty but slowly the patrons started coming out for a drink and by 11pm, the place was decently packed for a Thursday night in Adams Point.  The drinks are good and reasonably priced.  I had something called the Green Bulliet and it hit the spot (although it's no Kentucky Buck from Rickhouse).I was impressed with the music.  They had a DJ spinning an eclectic mix of early 90s hip hop, random pop tunes, house, funk, etc and I was digging it!Would def return for another drink, and always a bonus that it's only a 3 min walk from the crib.  Welcome to the neighborhood 398!
Pretty chill atmosphere for all the Adam's Pointers to enjoy, gather, imbibe and chat. An okay neighborhood watering hole; it's got a little swagger without being too pricey or pretentious.

No change to the star rating, but I just had to add to my previous review in lieu of the odd experience I just lived through at Room 389.I had stopped by for a bit early on in the evening and hung out in the back "lounge" area -- at the time, all seemed normal. Then I returned a few hours later, around 12:30. Suddenly the back room seemed to have turned into a 7th grade rec room party filled with couples making out. One duo was full-on dry humping in the presence of everyone. Meanwhile, the front of the bar was totally normal. My friend and I were highly confused -- is it a "business in the front, party in the back" sort of situation? One part sports bar, two parts Power Exchange? WTF is going on at this place after the clock strikes midnight?I wanted to ask someone but they were all busy stuffing their tongues down each others' faces.
nice spacefriendly bartenderskettle one + fresh squeezed grapefruit

Room 389 opened during my unfortunate absence from the Bay. I'm glad that not too many people seem to have caught on to this bar like they have the Heart and Dagger. It's never too crowded, and it's great for a small group since there are typically some great tables open.It's not dirt cheap as the prices I have gotten used to in Virginia...or as the Heart and Dagger, but it's a nice change of pace, and is still decently priced. They have friendly bartenders (hi, Jacques!), and there's a decent drink special where you can buy a whiskey and get a can of PBR free.D's a little miffed that the Golden Bear closed, but I think he'll get over it simply with the knowledge that there's a fun, affordable bar within walking distance to the apartment.

My new favorite spot to hear good music, check out sweet local artwork, and drink muddled drinks with fresh garnishes. I'm really not a heavy drinker, but these greyhounds are poured just right!  P.s. I'm loving all the plant life.
I love this place. There are always a good crowd of friendly people to share a pitcher. We've met some amazing people - the place just seems to attract them.

Before I get into a proper review of Room 389, let me just say that I think naming your bar or restaurant after your street address is fucking WAY out of control. Stop already. Get creative and stop being lazy.Anyways. Room 389 is a huge improvement over the Golden Bear that used to be at this spot on Grand, with a spacious bar, comfy tables, couches in the back, a DJ booth, and black urinals in the men's room. The drinks were decent but I thought the $6 beers were a little pricey. Music was generic R&B and pretty boring, but the bartender was super nice and I loved the space. Please don't turn super douchey. Pleasepleaseplease!
Nice atmosphere. Very neighborhood bar-like.  Prompt service.  Loved the books tacked to the walls. Busy on a weekend night.

Went to Room 389 for a little date night with hubby & we both loved it. Seating was a bit limited (the back room was taken up by a big party), but what bar isn't. After we finally grabbed a seat at the bar we started with the special cocktail menu (I ordered the bourbon drink I forget the name of but it was FAB) then continued on with some beers and even got to try some drinks tailored to our tastes by our patient and helpful bartender. Did I mention that you can also order some of the best shrimp wontons from next door and eat them at this bar? They'll even deliver them to you! Room 389 has a great neighborhood atmosphere without being dingy or divey in the bad way. It's decor is stylish, crowd is sophisticated but unpretentious, the cocktails are delish and bar is well stocked. Def add to your places to try if you're in the area.

A sleek, cool, vibey Soho feel in the heart of the Grand Lake area. What's not to like?Service: great. check.Drinks: well-made, generous and moderately-priced, considering the inside wonders. check.Atmosphere: A smidgen of Brooklyn, Soho and the lower villiage with Oakland attitude. Hipster meets the Executive with some great tunes too and two excellent plasma screens to watch a few NBA/NFL games. Nice.Room 389 is not perfect, but darn close. The owners, Ben and Jaime, have carefully crafted a nice place to hoist a few and the results are obvious.Huzzah!
a very welcome addition to the neighborhood, indeed. warm and cozy...a great spot to rendezvous and enjoy good drinks :)

Such an attractive bar. Also a very attractive, well groomed, snazy dressing, mixed crowd. Mostly 30-45 age group- employed, educated, and well mannered. Oh and they all seem to know how to have a good time. This is a great place to watch sports. It is also an excellent choice if you want to have a real cocktail, not just a jack and coke or long island. Their martinis rock, they make a mean margarita, an eye poppin bloody mary, and a handful of fun, fruity, sweet, girly drinks. Yum.. and their prices are decent too!
Great neighborhood bar.  Easy, breezy, pleazie atmosphere....I wish there were more just like close by!Come on EASt BAY!

This place is nice-ish.  The interior looks a bit hip, a bit cozy.  There's kind of a [i]Walnut Creek on a Saturday night[/i] feel to it, but that's more due to the number of striped shirts than the decor.  The back area is comfy if you can get  a seat.The bar has one really good bartender, one who has been awful each time I've encountered her, and one who macks on the ladies and points down the bar at the bad one.  Maybe he's not a bartender but rather a lounge lizard who got stuck on the wrong side of the oak planks.  Maybe he's also pointing at her as a warning.The drinks are good.  Their greyhound has really good fresh-squeezed juice and they make good sazeracs.  The prices are good for what they provide.  So yes, it's a good little place, but they could use a an extra bartender or two and the bad one needs to be shown the door.

I'm new to town, so I can't comment on previous owners or how it has changed here. But so far, I am loving Room 389. I'll keep it simple, here's why:- First time there, a low key Sunday evening so it wasn't very busy. Great atmosphere and decor. Awesome smooth music on the radio. Great vibe. We wanted to stay longer, but work was calling in the morning...- Second time there, for a World Series Giants game. The bar was packed but the bartenders were on top of it. Great customer service. Friendly and fast.- The bartenders here know how to make cocktails. Too many places are just a shot and a beer. They know the real thing here. I wasn't sure what I wanted and asked for some sort of light, champagne cocktail. The bartender got it just right.- A guy out front was making sandwiches, if you got hungry, but know that he is a separate biz and takes cash only. Plus there's a pizza place across the street or an asian place next door. Someone said that they don't mind if you bring in outside food. Bonus.- Beyond that, we met some really nice people at this bar. Staff and patrons alike. It goes a long way when you instantly feel comfortable somewhere.- I saw that they have a record-spinning (as in real vinyl) DJ on Thursdays. That will be my next stop in! Can't wait.

Usually I like to go to a bar at least twice before I review it....but I really like this place and wanted to write them a good review right away!My two friends and I came here after grabbing Ahn's burgers down the block.  No problems about waltzing in with food, and the bartender even asked if we needed plates or utensils (we didn't, but nice gesture).  He gave my friend a taste of the seasonal brew immediately, and made a geeky Chronicles of Narnia joke about it (yesssss!). Super friendly service.Beers were on the cheap end ($4) and I didn't try any of the cocktails, but they looked fancy-schmancy. Looks like they have a DJ fairly often...nice touch. A cool music scene on top of geeky literature references and cheap beers in a classy locale? Yay, I'm DEFINITELY a fan!

Great new spot in Oakland, which definitely has a shortage of cool hangout bars with TVs. Excellent service and great vibe. The interior layout is nice. Its a very comfortable place, just wish the music was a bit less R&B urban and more alternative rockish, maybe it depends on the night and mood of the staff. Well you can't have everything. The woman bartenders are pretty friendly too, as was the owner when I chatted with him about the place. Good location and usually easy to find safe parking on the street. Also they allow you to bring in food from the local restaurants as well as the occasional grill that is set up in the front. If I were going to open a bar in Oakland, this would the model.  The one downside, the front patio is a haven for smokers, and their smoke can get blown into the bar when the front door is open. All in all, glad I found this place.

OVER RATED. yeah it's not to shabby inside compared to how it used to be, the owners did a decent job of rehabbing it but the music is sometimes obnoxiously loud, their pours are weak and inconsistent, and they claim they are a "neighborhood" bar yet they disrespect all the people that live around them on an almost nightly basis by letting drunk patrons make a bunch of noise in their mini patio. Irresponsible owners and weak over priced pours = below average bar.

We stopped here after dinner over at Boot and Shoe Company to check it out.  Loved the quirky, retro, literate decor, the comfortable seating, the friendly bartender, and the great cocktails.  Did not love the totally incongruous reggae music.   Just what I want with my basil-infused top shelf Manhattan... reggae music.This prompted a debate about whether these quirky, retro, interesting bars with artisan drinks and ill-fitting music that pop up are actually the brain-child of the owners, or just some decorating concept that some terrible consultant pastes on but no one really cares about,  or if the concept is really important to the Powers That Be but they just forgot about the music (we're looking at you, Era), or what.  Fortunately somebody changed the music to a great blues sampler so we could concentrate on our excellent cocktails, and the endless debate about how much bike evangelism is too much versus just enough to prompt useful shifts in transit habits.  Important things.  We'll be back for sure.

Yes, a cozy bar in my neighborhood - good for a cold one on the way home from work or from a workout.  They have up to 10 beers on tap, and I plan on working my way down that row, as time goes by.  A very positive addition to the strip along Lake Merritt/Adams point,  Two big flat screens focussing on local sports is also a plus. I'll be back.

I love this bar! I walk in and feel a warm grown-up vibe. The Wed night bartender is super sexy, made me a wicked cocktail ("here, try this..."), and plays a selection of music ranging from original Jamaican ska to funky soul. This is my kind of place. To bad it's not my neighborhood bar, but worth joining up with my friends for.

Sigh. Another bar that uses its address as its name so that I never remember what the place is actually called. This place doesn't strike me as a destination spot, maybe more like a neighborhood bar, but I haven't been during weekend nights, so maybe it's more bumpin then. I went on a weekday evening, vibe was pretty mellow, bartender was nice.I was starving when I showed up, and they don't serve food, but they were totally okay with us bringing in food from elsewhere (I grabbed a burger and fries from Ahn's a couple doors down), as long as we threw our own trash out (apparently they compost/recycle all of their waste) - bonus star for the lax food policy and the composting!

They have fresh squeezed orange and grapefruit juice! YUM!The decor is really creative and comfortable and the bar just has a good vibe. The owners clearly honor and respect their customers, which is refreshing! Also, they were grilling out front today! How fun!+++p.s. forgot to mention that they are DOG friendly! It's very cool to be able  to bring your dog in!

This bar is so perfect it makes me angry at the other bars.Like, is it so hard to have nice decor, solid music and great drinks?Maybe it is.In any event, these guys got it right with 389.*Bonus points for the paperback book "wallpaper" and comfy lounge seating in the back. **Super deluxe bonus points for the fresh squeezed juices and bowl of grapefruits on the bar.

Room 389 is a dream of a local bar. Highlights include an attentive,  friendly group of bartenders and backs, terrific drinks, and great music. It's not too chic and not too shabby. A drunkard's dream if I ever did see one...

Gorgeous bar, beautiful artwork on the walls. Loved the huge corkboard that line the walls covered with old sheet music, pages from classic novels, etcFriday night amd the DJ was spinning jams from roots reggae to soulful house. Big tip of the hat to the bartender who gave everyone at the bar a heads up that the meter maid was  "ticketing like crazy". I beat out a parking ticket just in time.

I have been praying to the bar gods for a bar, literally crawling distance from home.  Who woulda thought, prayers do work as Room 389 was recently born. I was willing to settle for a hole in the wall dive bar, really anything with a liquor license (what can I say, I'm a cheap date). Gosh darn though were my dreams made true with 389!! It walks the fine line between approachable, friendly neighborhood bar, and cheek, quality, first date impress.  It's obvious the owners value their alcohol as much as the service. 5 very shiny stars for room 389!

Room 389 is awesome. The ambience and atmoshere is great! The bartenders / owner are extremely friendly, humorous, inviting, and down to earth.  James' dirty martini was our drink of the night and made to perfection.  We will definitely be coming back to chill, relax, and for some laughs.The vibe and energy of Room 389 is very refreshing to this part of town. You'll have a great time whether you go solo or with a group.

This place gets extra points for exercising the demons left behind by the locations previous two tenants.  I do not like to speak ill of the dead, but Golden Bear and Dapper sucked out loud.  However, Room 389 is not just great in comparison to those two festering neighborhood sores.  The vibe is sophisticated without being intimidating.  Everything has been thought of, but not over-thought.  The result is complete comfort and ease.  If you come in for a drink, you will undoubtedly stay for three.
Yes yes yes! Love it. Thank you for being in Oakland, 389 people.

Wonderful addition to Oaktown. Gone are the bleachers and muck from the old Golden Bear (like) and Dapper Lounge (ick). In their place is a comfortable, inviting, friendly scene with great cocktails (gimlet with Elderberry flower - YUMYUM), a wide selection of good brew on tap and a long, solid bar with ample seating. This is a place you could take anyone: in-laws, grandparents, cool hipster friends. Looking forward to going back soon.
Nice place. Warm atmosphere.  Stone and Lagunitas on tap! Goodbye Golden Bear and the short lived Dapper Lounge. Room 389 is a welcome replacement.

Yay! I love this place. My sister called it my 'Regal Beagle'. Yep.. it's the new neighborhood bar. I'm excited to go back. I can't wait to see what kind of Dj's they have and if there is dancing or not. Pretty cool place!!!

I've lived in Adams Point a little while, and when I checked this place out last weekend I almost kissed the ground. It's super easy going yet quietly sophisticated, taking the Golden Bear Lounge and politely bidding it's memory adieu with a wonderful incarnation of the space.    The nice, long metal bar with wood trim (important and not un-noticed detail, owners) has double hooks under the entire bartop for the ladies as well. There is some nice art in the back half of the bar, which is wider and more open and looks like it could sustain some serious dancing if need be.    I saw them making tons of ruby red grapefruit greyhounds using this huge  fruit press in the middle of the bar, so I finally broke down and wondered what all the fuss was about. What I got was pretty damn good, and so simple: I ordered a hangar one greyhound and the barkeep cut a grapefruit in half, pressed it and added 2 ounces of vodka, and shook it. That thing tasted like it was still fruit it was so delicious. I was not mad. Not mad at all. I think the hangar was $8 but with 2 ounces thats a steal.   So thats what I got- cool place, great vibe, you can smoke outside in the front patio WITH your drink and they mentioned that they're throwing down BBQ every Sunday in the day during football season. I highly recommend Room 389, especially to all my neighbors who now have a neighborhood bar again!

Very nice open and light area with cute bartenders and a nice vibe.  A very welcome addition to Adams Point.  The $8 shots of Bulliet have to go though!  The $3.5 tallboys of PBR at Heart and Dagger are right down the street!
What can I say... cute bartenders and taliskar?  5 stars.

Wow.  The old Golden Bear/Dapper Lounge has reopened with a very new vibe.  I walked in one afternoon, seeing a few people inside, and got a warm greeting from the bartender, who told me they'd just opened the night before. It's a big, spacious place with a long bar, a few tables, TVs, and big open windows facing the street.  In the back, you'll find couches and a few tables to increase the "lounge" cred. The beer list was long and mostly priced at $5, with a few specialities like Chimay at $8. The afternoon crowd matched the neighborhood... including a dog and a kid. Nice. Coming back a few days later, at night, the dark wood, mood lighting, and mellow music transformed the place into a softer, more rustic version of Easy. It's definitely aiming toward a more upscale crowd.Seven years in Adams Point and I've never had a real local (The Alley is across the freeway, really).  Let's see.
